Reyna es una persona humilde y luchadora tiene 26 años y atiende el negocio que es una pequeña tienda. 
Reyna fue criada por sus abuelos, porque ella a la edad de tres años quedo huerfana de ambos padres, gracias a sus abuelitos logro estudiar hasta 8° grado por falta de recursos economicos no continuo, Reyna se casó y tubo dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 4 años, su esposo trabaja como jefe de personal en una granja. 
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arena, grava, cemento para construir un local para ubicar su tienda, ya que se llena de clientes y tiene muchos productos, pero quiere comprar más.

Ella quiere que sus hijos sean profecionales y seguir trabajando honestamente y con ayuda de Dios salir adelante.
texts.en:
Reyna is a humble person who is a fighter. She is 26 years old and works at her business, which is a small store.  Reyna was raised by her grandparents because at the age of three she was orphaned. Thanks to her grandparents, she was able to go to school up to the 8th grade but due to a lack of resources she didn't continue. Reyna married and had 2 children, aged 10 and 4. Her husband works as a supervisor at a farm.  
 
The loan she is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy sand, gravel, and cement to build a locale for her store. She has a lot of customers and many products, but she wants to buy more. 

She wants her children to graduate from college and work honestly and with God's help, get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and cement to build a locale for her store. She has a lot of customers and many products, but she wants to buy more.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanzita Group

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos y reside con su familia en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y café, siendo el cultivo de café el mas fuerte desde hace 8 años, el cual vende en el mercado local. el préstamo que ha solicitado es su segundo ciclo y es por 3,500 lempiras, con el cual va comprar abonos para fertilizar su parcela de café y poder sacar mejor cosecha e ingresos. El préstamo es en forma grupal que se llama Nueva Esperanzita, y esta formado por 7 integrantes que se dedican a la agricultura y residen en la misma zona. El monto total es por 27,500 lempiras para fertilizar sus fincas de café. En la foto se identifican así: a la derecha esta Olger, sigue José, German, Marina, José Dolores, Miguel Y Cándido a la izquierda.
texts.en:
Miguel, 28, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in a village that belongs to the Gracias, Lempira municipality. He has always made a living cultivating basic grains such as corn, beans, and coffee. His coffee crop is the strongest it's been in eight years, and he sells it in the local market.

The loan his is requesting is his second cycle and it is for 3,500 HNL. With the loan, he will buy manure to fertilize his coffee crop so he can have a better harvest and income.

The loan comes in the form of a group loan with Nueva Esperanzita. It is comprised of seven members who all work in agriculture and live in the same area. The loan is for 27,500 HNL to fertilize their coffee crops.

In the photo, from the right are Olger, José, German, Marina, José Dolores, Miguel, and Cándido.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilizer coffee crops.

loans.name: Yunly

texts.en:
Yunly, age 49, is married and a mother of five children, all of whom are still dependent. 

This is the first time for Yunly to be a Kiva borrower and appear on the website. She is a resident of Kang Meas district, where she and her spouse help each other cultivate land for growing rice. Yunly has taken a loan for USD 2,000 to build a latrine for her household. She will buy construction materials needed and pay for labors costs. This will enable her to build a healthy family and protect her family members from unexpected illness. 

She is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than the usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a woman who stands out for searching any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family. Five years ago she began helping her husband in working in their own farm. She thanks God for this occupation, since the result was very rewarding and her produce was abundant.

Based on this success, Loida is asking for a loan for additional capital to improve the farm. She needs to buy additional fertilizer and seeds to plant in the other plot. She is always looking for the well being of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and seeds to plant in the other plot.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 53 years old and lives in Prey Chhor Dristrict of Kampong Cham Province. She has been working as a farmer for more than 30 years and she can make around $2 per day. Sokhom is a mother of two unmarried children and one married child.

This is the first time for Sokhom to be a Kiva client since now she really needs a package of money to support her farming business. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and hire some laborers to help her in farming. Finally, she is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than the usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and hire some laborers

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sugar, wheat flour, salt, and maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, salt, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs. 

Nora requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Nora has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Nora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edith de 24 años de edad, es una persona que no tubo la oportunidad de prepararse ya que sus padres no contaban con dinero suficiente para mandarla a estudiar y lastimosamente solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado de educacion básica. Actualmente esta acompañada, su pareja trabaja se dedica al comercio, hasta el momento no tienen hijos en la escuela ya que su unica hija tiene apenas cuatro años de edad. Con ella solo vive su compañero de vida y su hija.

Edith se dedica al cultivo de platano dice que desde hace dos años esta cultivando platanos, esto lo aprendio de su familia que siempre se han dedicado a eso, ademas de ellos en el canton donde ella vive dice que la mayor parte de la gente se dedica a la cultivacion de platano y a la agricultura,su compañero de vida se dedica a jornalero realiza trabajos pequeños en la comunidad. Antes de dedicarse a esto, ella cosechaba maiz pero dice que le hace mas rentable el platano, el lugar donde cultiva el platano le queda a unos 4 km, de su casa se traslada en bicicleta.

El prestamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar los fertilizante necesarios para la siembra de platano, necesita comprar mas matas de platano para que su negocio sea mas productivo.Sus sueños son mejorar la producción de su platano, mejorar la calidad de vida, mejorar la calidad de estudio.
texts.en:
Edith is 24 years old. She is a person who didn't have the chance to get an education because her parents didn't have enough money to send her to school and unfortunately she was only able to go to school through the ninth grade. Right now she is married and her spouse works in businesses. So far, they have no children in school because their only daughter is only four years old. Her husband and her daughter are the only people who live with her.

Edith grows plantains. She has been growing plantains for two years. She learned it from her family, as they have always done this. In addition, she lives in a canton where most people grow plantains and farm. Her life's companion works as a laborer doing small jobs in the community. Before doing this, she grew corn but she says plantains are more profitable. The place where she grows the plantains is 4 km away and she gets there on bicycle. 

The loan she is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy the fertilizer she needs to plant the plantains. She needs to buy more plantain plants so her business will be more productive. Her dream is to improve plantain production, improve her quality of life and improve the quality of education.

loans.use: To buy the fertilizer she needs to plant plantains. She needs to buy more plantain plants.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sweets, and groundnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sweets, and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits and resell them to the local residents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel, a married woman with three children, owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products including soft drinks, soaps, and many other items to earn a living, and she's been in this business for more than six years. 

She was able to sustain her business and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. She took a new loan recently, to purchase additional grocery goods and bottled products to resell. In the future, Maribel wants to expand/improve her business and to support  her children's education  .

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery goods and bottled products to resell

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel works hard to support her family. Razel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Razel has been in this business for a year now, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase gasoline, fishing net and other fishing materials.

In the future, Razel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Chari is a married woman with five school-going children.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby.  

With the loan she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman aged 39 and lives in Hoima Uganda.She has five children aged between 25 and 14, and four of them attend school. 

She runs a clothing business and gets additional income from rentals. She desires to expand her business despite being limited by capital and high transport costs.

Florence is acquiring a loan to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.use: buy more clothes  for selling.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 

Monica has operated a beauty salon business for the past four years. Her customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a forty-year-old female married with eight children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. 

She is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa. She also has a retail shop to cater to her daily family expenses and has been in business for ten years. Zainabu dreams of having a very big shop that can serve new markets though limited funds affect her business. 

She intends to use the loan to buy toilet paper, trays of eggs, soap, match boxes, and soda  to sell.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, trays of eggs, soap, match boxes, and soda to sell.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a hardworking and enterprising woman who  owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with four school-going children.

She sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Jenifer Xiomara

texts.es:
Jenifer de 18 años de edad, es una joven que estudio hasta noveno grado de educacion básica, actualmente esta soltera vive con su madre, ella lo que gana solo es para su madre y para ella.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogos, negocio que a realizado durante dos años, esto le sirve como una fuente de ingresos para su casa, ella se siente bendecida ya que con lo poco de ingresos que obtiene puede ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ya sea para la alimentacion como para los pagos de recibos de energia electrica, etc, ella se desplaza por toda la comunidad vendiendo estos productos sus horarios a veces de 8am a 3 pm y asi son rotativos. 

La joven con el dinero solicitado a credicampo lo invertira en la compra de materiales para la construccion de un dormitorio, comprara 350 bloques, 12 bolsas de cemento y un quintal de hierro, asi mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Los sueños de Jenifer es tener un dormitorio aparte que tenga su privacidad, y trabajar para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jenifer, 18, is a young woman who went to school through ninth grade. Currently, she is single and lives with her mom. What she earns is just for her and her mother.

She makes a living selling cosmetics through catalogues, a business she started two years ago. This work serves as a source of income for her household. She feels blessed because the little income she earns can help her with household expenses, whether it be for food, electric payments, or others. Jenifer travels throughout the community selling these products. Her hours are 8a.m. to 3p.m. daily.

With the money she is requesting from Credicampo, she will invest in construction materials for her room. She will buy 350 blocks, 12 bags of cement, and a quintal of iron. This will improve her and her family's quality of life.

Jenifer's dream is to have a separate room so she can have privacy, and to work to help her family.

loans.use: to buy 350 blocks, 12 bags of cement, and a quintal of iron to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira, who is a 49-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Partskhma. She has a husband and a mother-in-law, whose monthly assistance 150 GEL is the only source of income for the family. Ira has a secondary education and that's why she can't find any stable job until now. Her husband is also temporarily unemployed, so they live in poverty and need some investment to satisfy the basic needs. 

Ira requested a loan of 2,200 GEL for starting a trading business and was approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the money she will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices to sell at increased prices in her community.
 
The new business initiative will help them to meet daily expenses. This will give Ira a chance to earn income and become financially independent. She will be grateful for the help Kiva lenders can provide.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing and start trading.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
At the age of 52, Joyce is the sole support for her three children since her husband is already dead. She gets her income by working in JED Hotel in Cauayan, Isabela, where she earns PHP 6,000 monthly. 

Since all of her children are attending school, Joyce wants to borrow a loan of PHP 200,000 for the tuition fee of her eldest child, Prexanne Mavis, who will be attending college. Prexanne Mavis aspires to be a writer or a journalist. According to her, she wants to uplift her family’s living condition and help her mother in supporting the educational needs of her younger siblings. Prexanne Mavis hopes that the lenders will grant her mother’s requested loan.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fee of her eldest child.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is working in her retail store every day to be able to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her family. She needs to move forward to earn more and also cover her household expenses.

Marieta is striving for a better life through her business, and she says that she is requesting this loan to buy additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very helpful in improving the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is very thankful for the loan assistance extended to her. She has used the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products to add in her inventory. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting another PHP 30,000 loan that she will use to purchase additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her income from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Angela simply dreams of an increase in profit through her hard work in business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her study of the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Deniz

texts.en:
Deniz is married and has two children, ages five and 12. She has been designing and selling jewelery for nine years. First she started this business at home and sold them to people she knew.  When the orders increased, she opened her own shop and continued selling from there. 

She is planning to increase the variety of her jewelry with help from the loan from Maya. Deniz also helps other housewives have their own jobs by giving them orders. In the future, Deniz plans to open a workshop and create more job opportunities for women. 

 
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Deniz Hanım, evli ve bir 5 diğeri 12 yaşında olmak üzere iki çocuğa sahip. Deniz Hanım 9 yıldır takı tasarımı ve satışı yapıyor. Bu işe önce evinde başlamış. Yaptığı takıları yakın çevresine satmış. Siparişleri artınca kendi dükkanını açmış ve satışlarına buradan devam etmiş. Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini geliştirmek istiyor. Deniz Hanım ayrıca ev hanımlarına takı siparişi vererek onlarında iş sahibi olmasına katkıda bulunuyor. Gelecekte ki en büyük hedefi bir takı atölyesi kurarak daha çok kadına iş imkanı sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Sandra Marilu

texts.es:
Sandra de 34 años de edad, se dedica  a los oficios domésticos , no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por el poco interés de sus padres, está casada  y su esposo trabaja en un pequeño taller de bicicletas que han puesto, uno de sus hijos estudia cuarto grado y la mayor ya no estudia. 

El taller lo tienen desde hace 9 años, Sandra es quien vende los repuestos y su esposo hace el trabajo y el negocio lo tienen en casa.

Ella necesita este crédito para ampliar el negocio del taller de bicicletas ya que no hay competencia en el lugar y por lo tanto necesita comprar de todo tipo de repuestos para bicicletas, a ella le gustaría que sus hijos se dedicaran al comercio ya que dice es una buena opción para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sandra, 34 years old, works doing the domestic chores. She didn't have the opportunity to study as her parents had little interest in it. She is married and her husband works in a small bicycle workshop that he started up. One of her children is in fourth grade and the oldest isn't in school anymore.

They have had the workshop for 9 years. Sandra is the one who sells the spare parts, and her husband does the repairs. The workshop is at their home.

She needs this loan to expand the bicycle workshop, as there is no competition in the area so she needs to buy all kinds of spare parts for bicycles.

She would like her children to work in the trade, as she says it is a good option to get on in life.

loans.use: to expand her bicycle repair workshop.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a widowed woman and with three school-going children, which is the reason of her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Dama operates a cafe business making items like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours.She cited seasonality  as a major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for the business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for the business.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 55 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo está pensionado, tienen 2 hijos pero ya no dependen de ellos.

Ella se dedica al trabajo del hogar ya que su esposo es el que siempre ha trabajado y llevaba el sustento de su familia.

Deysi necesita este crédito para poner una tienda, comprará productos como galletas, churros, gaseosas, refrescos, etc.

Ella sueña con hacer un negocio grande para poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Deysi is 55 years old. She studied up to fourth grade, is married, her husband is on a pension, they have two children but they are no longer dependent on them.

She does the housework, as it was her husband who always worked and sustained the family.

Deysi needs this loan to start a shop. She will buy products such as cookies, churros, soda and drinks, etc.

She dreams of making the business big enough to be able to make the necessary income to sustain her family.

loans.use: to open a shop and buy cookies, churros, soda and drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor de 23 años de dad, actualmente tiene un taller de pintado y enderezado en el cual trabaja, solo vive con su compañera de vida que se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su hijo de 4 años.

Rafael tiene mucha experiencia en pintado y enderezado, el oficio lo aprendió de un buen trabajador que es su amigo y lo orientó cuando trabajaba de empleado hace 10 años, en 2005 puso su propio taller y es de ello que obtiene los ingresos para el hogar y para pagar la cuota de un lote que está pagando. 

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando al cliente, para pagar un crédito que su madre tiene en una institución.

Rafael quiere terminar de pagar su lote y poder en un futuro construir una casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is a very hardworking and enterprising young man, 23 years of age. Currently, he has a paint and body shop where he works. He only lives with his life partner who occupies herself with the domestic tasks and his child, aged 4.

Rafael has a lot of experience in painting and body work; he learned the work from a good worker who is his friend and guided him when he worked as an employee 10 years ago. in 2005, he started his own shop and it's from this that he obtains income for the home and to pay the installments for land that he's paying.

With the loan, you will be helping the client to pay back a loan that his mother has in an institution. Rafael wants to finish paying for his land and be able to build a house for his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a loan that his mother has in an institution.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 60 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child, who is now an adult.
 
Meriam is engaged in a food supplement multi-level marketing and direct selling business for three years already. Meriam earns approximately PHP10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing more stocks of food supplement for her multi-level marketing and direct selling business. 

Meriam has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Meriam hopes to expand her business by opening a center.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing more stocks of food supplements for her multi-level marketing and direct-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for her oldest daughter.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia de 44 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, agua, gaseosas, jugos, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Zonia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Zonia is 44 years old and a single mother who lives in a rented house with her two children. She sells soft drinks, sodas, water, juice, etc. Her business is located in her house and she pays the household expenses with what she earns. Zonia is requesting a  loan to buy more products wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and provide a better quality of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, sodas, water, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to build a roof on a room.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from the province of Misamis Occicental. She has been operating her general store for more than five years. She also raises pigs for sale, and she earns additional income from it. 

In 2013, Marilyn joined GDMPC, and she gained access to financial services. This has helped to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods, dairy products, and bottled products to sell. She wants to have a better living for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods, dairy goods, and bottled products to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a fishing business in Plaridel. She and her husband work hard to support their family through fishing. Elizabeth is a pioneer member of PMPC Microfinance and has remained a member with the label of member of good standing. She has no record of default in her credit dealings with the Cooperative. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase an additional fish net. She wants to improve the catch by adding a fish net. She is confident that they will earn more with this addition. 

Elizabeth is happy to live comfortably with her family around her, and with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fish net.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is very thankful for the previous loan extended to her, as she was able to buy additional stocks of bananas and other products like charcoal, cigarettes, and candies needed in her mini-variety store. Together with her husband, she works hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting another loan- this time for PHP 37,000. She will use the new loan to buy additional supplies of products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and provide for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marieta, together with her family, hopes to experience a prosperous kind of living someday. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock, such as charcoal, cigarettes, candies, and bananas needed in her business.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is a single entrepreneur with an only child.  She operates a general store to make a living. In addition, she also vends snacks to earn extra income. 

She has run the business for 2 years and earns enough to support the needs of her family.  In order to increase her inventory, she joined GDMPC a year ago. She requests a  loan  to purchase merchandise such as basic grains, toilet paper, powdered milk, mortadella [sausage], toothpaste, tomato sauce, cleaning supplies, juice, and soda. 

Her dream is to grow her business and earn a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, toilet paper, powdered milk, mortadella [sausage], toothpaste, tomato sauce, cleaning supplies, juice, soda, and among other items.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items needed in her variety store. She was also able to help and support her family. Her income from business meets her everyday needs and expenses. She continues to work hard to provide for her daily expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness.

Genalyn hopes that her business will become stable and dreams to have a better future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello World, meet Beatrice. This mother of one lives on a small piece of land in Kericho, which is a deep rural county known for tea plantations, in Kenya. Beatrice has been involved in farming for more than four years, earning her family a decent living through the sale of farm produce. 

Beatrice keeps poultry and dairy cattle for eggs and milk. On her farm, she also grows tea and vegetables. Of all the activities she is involved in, she finds poultry farming the most natural and enjoyable. 

“My parents kept poultry before I was born. Growing up, poultry has been a part of my life,” she says. The biggest challenge she dreads is outbreak of disease. This negatively affects productivity of the animals and a farmer like Beatrice may lose her animals and birds to death. 

Beatrice is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. She has a cow named Lelmet that is carrying a calf. Beatrice’s biggest worry is that Lelmet lacks shelter. This makes her vulnerable to adverse weather that may lead to poor health.

With your lending, Beatrice is going to improve the state of her dairy farm and introduce zero-grazing in future. This will significantly lead to increased productivity and income for her family. Beatrice sees a brighter future, where her family will be leading a life with improved living standards.

loans.use: To improve her dairy farm by constructing a cowshed for her cow.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 58 years old and operates a fish business that he started in 1980 so as to take care of his family. His dream is to expand the business into new markets- supplying fish in different places. Bad weather and inadequate storage facilities hinder his business.
Fred is acquiring a loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: buy more fish for selling

loans.name: Miguel De Jesus

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven muy trabajador de 26 años de edad,  solo estudió  hasta bachillerato, luego emigró hacia los Estados Unidos. Actualmente vive con su mamá que se dedica a los oficios domésticos y una hermana que estudia.
Miguel trabajó 2 años en los Estados Unidos en construcción, luego decidió regresar porque las oportunidades de trabajo eran mínimas y muy peligrosas. Hoy en día esta trabajando en un taller de mecánica automotriz reparando vehículos. Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando a Miguel para que pueda pagar un crédito que tiene en un banco y lo demás lo utilizará para sembrar media hectárea de maíz ya que se acerca la época de siembra.Miguel desea casarse y tener una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very hardworking young man of 26. He only studied until high school. Later, he emigrated to the United States. Currently, he lives with his mother who works on the domestic tasks and a sister who studies.

Miguel worked for 2 years in the United States in construction. Later, he decided to return because there were fewer and very dangerous work opportunities. Today, he is working in an auto mechanic shop repairing vehicles. With the loan, you will be helping Miguel so that he can pay back a loan that he has at a bank. He will use the rest to plant a half hectare of corn since the planting season is approaching. Miguel wants to get married and have a beautiful family.

loans.use: to pay for a loan that he has at a bank.

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, es un padre responsable y muy trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos a quienes les brinda los estudio, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos mientras él trabaja en la agricultura y también se desempeña en las labores de motorista. José viajó al extranjero en el 2000 pero regresó en el 2005 para estar junto con su familia y cuidar de sus seres queridos.
En la época lluviosa José se dedica a la agricultura de donde obtiene los granos básicos que se consumen en el hogar, además él es dueño de un microbus con el que realiza viajes y un camión de cargamento pesado. Además realiza trabajos ganaderos pues ordeña 6 vacas que son de su propiedad y en su tiempo libre asiste a la iglesia de la comunidad donde presta su servicio como sacristán. 
Él necesita este préstamo para comprar 2 novillas que le ofrecen a buen precio y no cuenta  con la cantidad suficiente para adquirirlas pues invirtió su dinero en la siembra.

Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada y sean personas de bien que todo lo que obtengan sea con esfuerzo propios, que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
José, 43, is a responsible and very hardworking father. He lives with his wife and their 4 children, whom he enables to study. His wife works on the domestic tasks while he works in agriculture. He also works as a motorist. José traveled abroad in 2000 but he came back in 2005 to be with his family and take care of his dear ones.

During rainy season, José works in agriculture, where he obtains the basic grains that they consume at home. Additionally, he is the owner of a microbus, with which he makes trips, and a heavy cargo truck. Additionally, he carries out animal husbandry activities: he milks 6 cows that are his property. In his free time, he helps the church of the community where he offers his services as a sacristan.

He needs this loan to buy two heifers that they are offering him at a good price. He doesn't have the amount necessary to acquire them because he invested his money in planting.

His dream is that his children will never lack anything and that they will be good people who all obtain everything by their own effort, who study and who become professionals.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, con mucho sacrificio estudió hasta bachillerato, se casó y ahora tiene tres hijos que estudian, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura desde hace más de cinco años, además se dedica a otra actividad económica  la cual es una tienda  que tiene ubicada en su propia casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para el manejo del cultivo y para poder tener una buena producción y que de esta manera no falte el alimento para su familia.
Rosa sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos, y, también esperan tener buenas ganancias para cancelar el crédito, seguir trabajando en la agricultura y tener siempre alimento para su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old. With a lot of sacrifice, she studied up to bachillerato [secondary school]. She got married and now has three children who are in school. Her husband is farmer.

She and her husband have worked in agriculture for more than five years. They also have another business, which is a shop located in their own home.

She needs this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to manage her crop and to be able to have good output, and in this way, she will not lack in food for her family.

Rosa dreams of getting her children ahead in life, and also they hope to have good earnings to repay the loan, keep working in agriculture and always have food for their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her crop.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is taking a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is married, and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, noodles, bread, eggs, and oils. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, noodles, bread, eggs, and oils

loans.name: Prisilar

texts.en:
Prisilar is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is married with six school-going children. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Prisilar sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her biggest challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is married and has a 5-year-old daughter. Her husband sells olives and olive products. She sells cosmetics and cleaning products. She not only sells these products, but also enables other women to become members and have their own jobs selling these products. 

She is using a Maya loan for the third time. During this period she has developed her work, increased her capital, and reached more people. She has contributed both to her family's income and the country's economy. She is a hard-working woman and loves women's solidarity. She is using a group loan.



Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ayşe Hanım,evli 5 yaşında bir kız çocuk annesi. Eşi zeytin ve zeytin ürünleri satışını yapıyor. Ersağ Kozmetik ve Temizlik Ürünleri pazarlaması yapıyor. Hem satış yapıyor hemde kendisi gibi kadınları üye yaparak iş yapmalarına vesile oluyor. Maya'dan 3'üncü kez kredi kullanıyor. Bu süreçte işini geliştirmiş. Sermayesini arttırmış. Daha çok kişiye ulaşmış. Aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Çalışkan bir kadın. Kadın dayanışmasını seviyor. Grup kredisi kullanıyor.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Melike

texts.en:
Melike is a young and hardworking entrepreneur. She is financing her own school expenses by selling beauty products. First she became a member to supply her own make up needs, later on she built a team by selling the products in her circle of friends. 

With the loan she borrowed from Maya, she has increased her product amount, bonus, profit, and capital. Melike, who is a hardworking and ambitious, carries the responsibility to take care of her own financial needs while she studies. She is planning to become a director at the company.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Melike Hanım, genç ve çalışkan bir girişimci.  1,5 yıldır oriflame güzellik ürünleri satarak okul ihtiyaçlarını karşılıyor.  Melike Hanım, önce kendi kozmetik ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için üye oluyor.  Daha sonra ekip kurarak ve ürünleri çevresine satarak kazancını artırıyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile daha fazla ürün alarak primini,kazancını ve sermayesini artırdı.  Azimli ve çalışkan bir yapıya sahip olan melike hanım ailesine yük olmadan okulunu bitirmek ve oriflame network sisteminde direktör olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a coffin.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta is married and has one child and  and lives in a town with her family.   

She opened her Mini shop  in 2000 with $ 200.00 of her own money. A $ 600.00 USD loan is offered to Augusta to improve her business.  She will use the loan to restock her store with shirts, trousers, shorts and children's wear.  Augusta is generating a good income from selling her things from the Mini shop.

She has thoughts of running a big business in the future, since she has been involved  in business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, shorts and children's wear.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 54 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros asi como muestra en la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su grupo familiar, Juan está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 54 years old and has been a farmer for several years.  He raises beans and corn, which is ready to store in barns once it’s harvested, as he shows in the image.  He later sells the crop and he uses the money to pay the household expenses.  He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man.  He lives with relatives.  Juan is asking for this loan to buy supplies for the harvest, such as fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc.  He doesn’t earn enough to cover these costs.  This will allow him to have a better income and increase his and his family’s financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Don julio es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus hijos, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor su principal siembra es el maíz, Don Julio desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros. Y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Julio is a very responsible man with his obligations at home, as it is typical of him to provide the best for his family. Today he lives together with his family made up of his wife and his children. He is very hard-working and he has always done this with joy and enthusiasm. He is a farmer, his main crop is corn.

Julio wants to increase his sales so he visited the offices of INTEGRAL to request a loan which would allow him to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, etc. He wants to improve the land you can see in the photo. He hopes to be able to count on the requested loan as he does not have any other monetary income and this will allow him to continue to earn the daily bread for his house with no problems.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertlizer, persticides, herbicides, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron bars, bricks, cement, sand, etc. in order to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Cesar Aduccio

texts.es: Cesar de 57 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos, de los cuales los dos mayores trabajan y ayudan en el hogar. Cesar  posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha. Muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles. Últimamente los clientes han aumentado y cada día la demanda es mayor. Su sueño es poder ver florecer su negocio y sabe que para eso tiene que invertir un poco más en la producción de tal forma que logre cubrir toda la demanda. Para esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is fifty-seven years old.  He lives in a house that he owns together with his life partner and their five children.  His two eldest children work and help out at home.  

Cesar has a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells furniture.  He has had this business for many years and thanks to God and his dedication, he has been able to keep his shop up and running.  Many people prefer his products because he offers high-quality furniture at good prices.  His customer base has grown and each day there is more and more demand.  His dream is to be able to see his business truly flourish.  He knows that for this to happen, he needs to invest a bit more in his furniture production process so that he is able to meet the demand.

He has therefore decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will invest in his business in purchasing wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other materials that will allow him to attract more customers.  This will help him to ultimately improve the quality of life for both himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other items.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, la higiene y la rapidez con que los atiende, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para seguir con su trabajo y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her two children. She makes and sells tortillas. Her business is located in her house. She has a lot of clients since she is friendly as she does her selling and her product is clean and the service quick. Ana is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime, to continue with her work and together with her family enjoy a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more educational materials.

loans.name: Renie

texts.en:
Richie is a single man who provides transportation services in their village to help his parents.  He plans to improve their house. He is still young and plans to have a family of his own. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to cover the maintenance costs for his motorcycle.  He used his income to pay for his own education.   His ambition is to finish a degree. 

In  the future, Renie wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva has a textile business in Hoima Uganda.  She is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. 

She sells mens' shirts and trousers.  She started business to increase her earnings. Besides selling clothes, she earns income from selling charcoal.   She desires to open another outlet. Fluctuating prices and demand affects her business.

Eva needs a loan to buy more shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: El señor Elías tiene 35 años, casado tiene un hijito de la edad de un año, se  dedica a la actividad de confección de ropa el confecciona Shorts, cortos deportivos, tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Senkata,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y el  señor Elías va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una maquina industrial y así de esta manera incrementar la confección de prendas de vestir ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus productos, el señor Elías tiene muchos pedidos que tiene que entregar ya que por estas fechas, el señor Elías es una persona muy trabajadora tiene ganas de seguir adelante de mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elias is 35 years old, married with a little one-year-old son, he works in garment manufacture. He makes shorts, sports shorts, he has his workshop in the Senkata zone. 

This is his first loan from the institution, and Elias is going to use the loan to buy an industrial [sewing] machine, and thereby increase the manufacture of garments as he has a lot of demands for his products, Elias has a lot of orders due at the same time. 

Elias is a very hardworking person who wants to get on in life and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
This is Luvuno. Her previous loan greatly helped her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to resell. The more items displayed at the store, the better. 

 She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness.

loans.use: to restock wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is a 62-year old married woman with two children. She has been a tailor for 45 years and works from home. She sews outfits to order and creates personal designs.  She used her earnings for her children's education and to ensure that they found jobs.

She will use the loan from Maya to replace her old sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Victor Salvador

texts.es:
Victor es un joven muy trabajador y responsable de 21 años de edad,  a su corta edad tiene muchas responsabilidades y las ha afrontado con mucho coraje. Actualmente él vive en la casa de sus padres, con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad.

Victor tiene mucha experiencia en la agricultura, ya que el oficio lo aprendió de un buen trabajador que es su padre, desde que tenia 10 años él iba con su papá a trabajar cultivando maíz, frijol y maicillo, además tiene el apoyo de toda su familia para trabajar.

Este joven  necesita el crédito para comprar 5 sacos de abono y 2 garrafas de herbicidas y además pagar mano de obra para agilizar los trabajos agrícolas.

Victor sueña con tener una casa propia y seguir produciendo granos básicos.
texts.en:
Victor is a very hardworking and responsible young man of 21 years. At his young age, he has many responsibilities and he has faced them with much courage. Currently, he lives in the house of his parents, with his life partner and their one-year-old child.

Victor has a lot of experience in agriculture, since he learned this work from a good worker who is his father. Since he was 10, he went with his father to work growing corn, beans and sorghum. Additionally, he has the support of all of his family to work.

This young man needs a loan to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and 2 barrels of herbicides and, additionally, pay for labor to streamline the agricultural work. Victor dreams of having his own house and to continue producing basic grains.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer, 2 barrels of herbicide and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Conchita

texts.es:
Cada día es un nuevo reto para María Conchita, una joven que desde temprana edad tuvo que involucrarse en el mundo laboral puesto que su familia no contaba con los recursos económicos. En la actualidad, tiene una pequeña pulpería y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Ella tiene 21 años de edad, está soltera y tiene muchas ganas de seguir superándose. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, recibe remesas por parte de su madre y sus tíos le han brindado conocimientos en zapatería y en bordado, para desenvolverse con éxito en la sociedad.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, su meta es que su pulpería crezca por lo tanto requiere de productos como granos básicos, aceite, condimentos, pan, gaseosas, productos lácteos, golosinas, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela un futuro próspero, aparte de laborar quiere terminar sus estudios de contabilidad y esta manera lograr una buena administración de su negocio. Maria con entusiasmo y dedicación planea mejorar su condición de vida, seguir aprendiendo y afianzando todos sus conocimientos y habilidades.
texts.en:
Every day is a new challenge for María Conchita, a young woman who, since an early age, had to involve herself in the working world given that her family didn't have economic resources. Currently, she has a small grocery store and at the same time, she makes a living selling shoes. She is 21 years old, single and is eager to continue improving herself. She has the support of her family. She receives remittances from her mother and her uncles; they have brought her knowledge in footwear and embroidery to get on in society with success.

She is applying for the loan to increase the production of her capital. Her goal is that her grocery store will grow, therefore she requires products like basic grains, oil, condiments, bread, sodas, dairy products, snacks, among others. She puts her trust in the loan, given that she yearns for a prosperous future. Apart from working, she wants to finish her accounting studies and, in this manner, achieve good administration of her business. María, with enthusiasm and dedication, plans to improve her living condition, continue learning and strengthening all of her knowledge and abilities.

loans.use: buy products like basic grains, oil, condiments, bread, soda, dairy products, snacks, among others.

loans.name: Tanja

texts.en:
Tanja is a mother of 2 children. Her husband does administrative work works in a municipality. She has operated a perfume shop for more than 12 years. She is very satisfied with her business and loves doing it.  She hopes to continue that work in the future. 

She sells a variety of perfumes and is very popular in the area, especially with the younger generation who are most of her customer base. In order for her to expand and grow the business, she would like a loan to purchase more items and perfume.  This would allow her to appeal to more clients and increase sales. 

She promises to pay on time and as a first time borrower, she wants to thank all of the lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pesticides for crop management

loans.name: Rosa Irma

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 52 años de edad, es una persona muy emprendedora y decidida a luchar, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a le escuela pues la situación económica de sus padres no era lo suficiente para los gastos educativos, se dedicó al trabajo en finca junto a sus padres y hermanos, se casó y es madre de 8 hijos de los cuales solo 7 viven con ella, su esposo tuvo que emigra a USA para poder ayudarle a ella y a los hijos.

Rosa se dedica solo a los oficios del hogar, antes tenía una pequeña tienda pero no contaba con el suficiente dinero para surtirla pues las ganancias las invertía en sus hijos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar medio terreno que le venden cerca de su casa, pues se le ha presentado esta oportunidad de invertir y la quiere aprovechar y así tener esa propiedad y trabajar algún tipo de cultivo y contar con ese capital familiar.
Ella sueña con que sus hijos se preparen académicamente y puedan tener un mejor futuro, además remodelar su casa y que su esposo regrese con bien de donde se encuentra para que la familia este unidad y puedan disfrutar muchas alegrías juntos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old.  She is a very enterprising person, determined to fight her way forward.  She didn’t have the opportunity to go to school due to her parents’ financial situation, which wasn’t good enough to cover educational expenses.  She went to work on the farm alongside her parents and siblings.  She got married and is the mother of eight children, only seven of whom live with her.  Her husband had to move to the U.S.A. to be able to help her and the children.

Rosa does the household chores.  Previously she had a small store but she didn’t have enough money to stock it because she invested her earnings in her children.

She needs this loan to buy half a plot of land they are selling near her house.  She has been presented with this investment opportunity and she wants to take advantage of it—owning that piece of property and working it for some type of crop.  In that way her family could have some capital.

She dreams that her children would be prepared academically and could have a better future.  She also dreams of remodeling her house and having her husband return safe and sound from wherever he is so that the family can be reunited and can enjoy many happy moments together.

loans.use: to buy half a plot of land they are selling near her house.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo de 51 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hija, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz,  elotes, berenjenas y güisquil; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Adolfo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, y mejorar el terreno q muestra la fotografía, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Adolfo is 51 years old and is friendly and hard-working. He lives with his wife and children. He works hard on his own plot of land where he grows corn, eggplant and chayote. His product is of high quality and when his harvest is ready he sells it in the different markets close to his residence. Adolfo is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to have the money needed to buy agricultural inputs like pest control. manure, fertilizer, seeds amongst other things he needs to plant and improve his land, which is shown in the photo. He longs to increase his sales to boost his profits and provide more financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy pest control, manure, fertilizer, seeds and other things he needs to plant and improve his land.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su compañera de vida y su hijo, el es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la mecánica de obra de banco (elaboración de estructuras metálicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos) desde hace varios años, Moises solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito para comprar más materiales como hierro, laminas, metal, electrodos, etc.  ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar.
texts.en:
Moises is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his family consisting of his life partner and his son.

He is a very responsible and hardworking man. He has been working as a “bench mechanic” (making metal structures such as doors, balcony railings, gates, and ceiling tiles) for several years. 

Moises is asking from a loan from Integral to buy more supplies such as iron, steel plates, metal, electrodes, etc., because the demand is high because he does good work. With his earnings he can support his family and pay the household expenses that occur.

loans.use: to buy iron, steel plates, metal, electrodes, etc., for his work

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es: Maria de 33 años de edad vive  en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 8 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar.  Maria solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maria, age 33, lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She has had a beauty salon in her home for eight years, and she works from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She has a lot of customers because she does very good work. With the earnings she makes and the help of her husband, they manage to pay the household expenses. Maria requests a loan to buy beauty products for her salon like: lotions, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, among other things she needs, and this way she can make better profits that will help her to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy lotions, shampoo, hair clips, and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Miguel Inebrando

texts.es: Miguel de 63 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: Miguel is 63 years old and has been working  as a farmer for a number of years. This has given him the knowledge and ability needed to assist his crops. His main crop is corn which he sells to the basic grain agencies that are close to his place of residence. He can help with his family's expenses with what he makes from his sales. He lives in his own house with his family. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural inputs that will help him grow his crops like: manure, seeds and  fertilizer to improve the land that is shown in the photo. Then he can enjoy better income and continue to help with the family expenses with no problems.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer to improve his land.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y su hija, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia adicional a eso trabaja como motorista de moto en una empresa privada, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que vende, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con lo su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, refrescos, sopas, etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is forty-six years old.  He lives in a house that he owns together with wife and their daughter.  He runs a store located in their home and also works as a motorist for a private company.  He has many customers at his small store because of the variety of products that he sells.  The income he earns from his sales and from his motorist job allow him to cover the home expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for his store, including basic grains, snacks, detergent, refreshments, soup, etc.  This will allow him to earn a larger income and to thereby give his family a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, detergent, refreshments, soup, etc.

loans.name: Isaura Suyen

texts.es: Isaura es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, ella se empeña a prosperar en la vida con su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa que ha logrado mantener con muchos esfuerzos y gracias al apoyo de su esposo y financiamiento, solicita el crédito para invertir en productos que beneficien tanto a su clientela como a su economía.
texts.en:
Isaura is the mother of three young children.  She always applies herself so that she may be successful in life with her small business selling clothing.  She has been able to maintain this business through her own efforts, support from her husband, and through financing opportunities.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise and products that will not only benefit her customers, but also her own economic status and well-being.

loans.use: to buy undergarments for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. Also, she was able to buy grocery items which now serve as their additional source of income.

Consequently, Virginia would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits, vegetables and other grocery supplies and products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams that she and her family will get ahead in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise rabbits.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Hello World! Meet Bernard. He lives on a small plot of land with his wife and two children in Kericho, Kenya. The climate in this area is excellent for agriculture! For the past five years, Bernard has been involved in farming. He keeps dairy cattle and poultry on his farm. He also grows tea for sale and vegetables for consumption. To further secure the financial status of his family, Bernard holds a job that guarantees an end month salary.

The thing that Bernard enjoys most is dairy farming. He was born into it and plans to do it for the rest of his days on earth. He named his cow Lelmet. The biggest challenge Bernard and other dairy farmers experience is low market prices for milk. 

Bernard is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter. Recently, he introduced zero-grazing to improve milk production. The problem he has had since introducing zero-grazing is preparing feed for the animals. He finds the process a bit strenuous, considering the cow used to do all the work before. 

With your lending, the chaff cutter Bernard will acquire will make his work a lot easier. Another merit is that chaff cutters chop grass into much smaller bits than when cut by hand, thus making it much better for animals to eat.
 
This loan will benefit Bernard’s family in many ways: Bernard will not break his bones preparing feed anymore; more pasture land can be prepared in a single day and stored for use for the whole week; the cattle will consume more feed because of its refined nature, leading to better health and increased milk production; and Bernard will soon realize an increase in his income.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter for cutting grass into small pieces to use as feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse to be able to grow vegetables throughout the year.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer multifacética, que a sus 36 años decidió establecer su propio negocio, donde comercializa vigoron desde su hogar, pero que su fuerte es la pulpería, que desde hace 11 años se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos. Esta madre de 47 años, les brindó a sus 3 hijos, educación y hogar, ahora todos son independientes y junto con su pareja administran el negocio. 

Anteriormente Doris había solicitado un préstamo para invertir en su negocio y comprar granos básicos, del cual se siente muy agradecida, ya que este crédito le permitió variar sus productos e incrementar sus ventas. Ahora necesita de un nuevo préstamo para volver a invertir en su pulpería y comprar granos basicos tales como: Arroz, Frijoles asi como Azucar, Verduras entre otros, pues piensa comprar en grandes cantidades para obtener mayores ganancias y brindar un mejor servicio. Al cancelar el préstamo asegura que seguirá trabajando fuerte para seguir creciendo y en un futuro conseguir otro préstamo que le permitirá cumplir este sueño.
texts.en:
Doris is a multifaceted woman, who at age 36 decided to set up her own business selling vigorón [a traditional dish of cabbage salad, pork rinds, and yuca wrapped in a banana leaf] from her home, but her strong point is her convenience store, which for eleven years was her only source of income.  This 47-year-old mother gave her three children an education and a home.  Now they are all living independently, and together with her husband, Doris runs her business.

Previously, Doris had asked for a loan to invest in her business to buy staples.  She is very grateful for that loan, because it allowed her to vary her merchandise and increase her sales.  

Now she needs a new loan to invest again in her convenience store, buying basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, and vegetables, among other items.  She thinks that buying in large quantities gets her better savings and better service.  Upon paying off her loan, she promises to keep working hard in order to continue growing and, in the future, take out another loan that will allow her to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, beans, sugar, and vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Marija

texts.en:
Marija is 41 years old and has three children. She and her family live in one of the minority communities of Kosovo working hard to ensure financial stability for her children, and to provide a better future for them. In order to do so, she works as a nurse and her husband is a taxi driver, both working hard and for long hours. 

Marija is asking for a loan for the first time in order to repair her husband’s taxi so that he can continue to provide service to others for a fee. This loan will ensure that they are able to maintain their income and even generate more clients, allowing them a chance to provide every opportunity for their children. She is very grateful to all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia Jovita continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de granos como trigo, maíz entre otros, la socia a la vez continua con su otro negocio de ferretería, él cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de granos como cebada entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Jovita continues to work in her business of buying and selling grains like wheat and corn, among others. At the same time she continues with her other hardware store business, which is doing well thanks to the work that she puts in every day. Jovita is a very responsible and hardworking person, and she hopes to be able to continue working in this way to support her family. She requests the loan to buy grains like barley, among others. She feels grateful for the loan being given to her, and she promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy grains like barley, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more educational materials for her oldest daughter.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita vende ricas e higiénicas tortillas en su casa de habitación, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas razón por la cual ya es muy conocida en la zona y los clientes la prefieren por brindar un buen servicio y sobre todo higiene y buenos precios en sus tortillas. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora cada día se pregunta cómo puede mejorar sus ingresos para poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida. Ella está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar maíz por mayor y cal. Tiene mucha Fe que tendrá éxito con la decisión tomada y sus condiciones de vida poco a poco se irán trasformando de manera positiva.
texts.en: Margarita sells tasty and hygienic tortillas from her house. She has been selling tortillas for many years now so she is well known in her area. Her customers prefer her and she provides good service, cleanliness and good prices for her tortillas. She is a fighter and entrepreneur who each day asks how she can imncrease her income so she can improve the quality of living for her family. She lives in her own house with her life partner. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy wholesale corn and lime. She has faith that she will have success with the decision taken and the conditions of her life will slowly transform in a positive manner.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el trabaja como albañil, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jorge está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito para terminar de construir su casa y asi comprar los materiales necesarios como: arena, ladrillos, cemento, hierro, piso cerámico, etc. para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Jorge, age 40, lives in his own home with his wife and his son. He works as a bricklayer, and through his work he manages to pay some of his living expenses. Jorge is requesting a loan to be able to improve his home by building a few rooms since, with what they earn, he has not been able to do this. For this reason he requests from INTEGRAL a loan to finish building his home and to buy the necessary materials like: sand, bricks, cement, iron, ceramic flooring, etc. so that his family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, iron, ceramic flooring, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario earns a living from collecting, buying and selling recyclables. For three years, Rosario has earned well and sustained the business. She also paid for some home improvements from her income. 

To add inventory capital, Rosario took a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more recyclables to resell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy more recyclables to resell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Joan. She is a hardworking lady who has been practicing agriculture for the last three years. She resides in Kericho, a beautiful countryside covered with manicured tea plantations. To afford a decent living, she sells milk, eggs and tea in the local market. 

Joan enjoys the company of her dairy cows. She spends quality time tending to them and names every animal on her farm, including the stray ones.
