Replanting is an activity that this small farmer has decided to undertake in a gradual manner. In the end, he will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring about more income so that he can provide better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Dina Angelica

texts.es: Dina tiene 42 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su hijo de 16 años de edad. Dina es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos en un hotel cercano a su localidad y es así como mantiene la economía de su hogar. Dina solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso.
texts.en: Dina is 42 years old and lives in her own home along with her 16 year old son.  She is a very hardworking woman and is dedicated to her family. For the past 11 years she has worked as a maid in a hotel near her home which enables her to pay her household expenses.  Dina is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to improve the conditions of the floor of her house.  With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand and floor bricks.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and bricks to pave the floor of her home.

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
For twenty years Lucia has helped her husband operate their own farm for a living, earning well to provide for their family.  She borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve the farm as they have planned.  Lucia always finds ways to augment their living.  

In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farm.

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
Saboat was born in 1962. She is married and brings up five children. Her children don’t work yet. Her husband, Kurbon, gets a small salary. Saboat is the main bread-winner of her family. She has been sewing for more than 30 years. Saboat sews men’s clothes, including trousers and suits. She works in a workshop. She has great experience in this field.

She needs to get financial support, because she is going to buy fabrics for increasing working capital. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni. She will use it to buy fabrics for increasing working capital. She hopes this loan will help her to develop her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mas is 32 years old and has a spouse. She works in an agricultural business, growing rice on a few pieces of farmland in Bakan district, Pursat province. From this business, she is able to earn a decent income to help with household expenses. This couple has two children; both of them are attending school.

Currently Mas’s family doesn't have adequate water to use at home, since her house is located a little bit far from the water resource. She has requested a loan of USD 750, which she will use to create a small pond, so that she can use that pond as her family’s water resource. She would like to thank honestly HKL and Kiva, for the water loan program they offer, with a special interest rate.

loans.use: to create a small pond, so her family can have adequate water at home

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia Esther se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,la socia se dedica al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Esther has a business selling food.  She has a restaurant business and prepares different dishes such as roasted chicken, soups, and meat stir fries.  She works from 8am to 6pm. She has had her business for 8 years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She is happy to get this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena manages a retail store in her community, to earn a living. She also buys coconuts and resells them in town, for more income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to sustain her business.

Her most recent loan is intended to purchase organic fertilizer, in order to improve the farm. She wants to increase the yield of her farm by using the fertilizer. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income, which would improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large amount of flour in order to increase the production of the bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crops in this new season.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de manzanas, plátanos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Bertha still has her business buying and selling fruit.  She has had this business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day.  She also still has a business providing transportation services. She wants to continue working in order to support her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase apples and bananas, and other fruit.  She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase apples, bananas, and other fruit.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Phoeurn is 39 years old and lives in Phnom Kravanh District, Pursat Province. She has been working as a farmer for more than 10 years and she can make around USD 3 per day. Sokhom is the mother of three unmarried children and one married child.

This is the first time for Phoeurn to be a Kiva’s client since now she really needs a package of money to build a hygienic latrine which she never has had before. She strongly hopes that this latrine will help improve her family's sanitation and health conditions. Finally, she is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en:
Piseth, age 32, is single. He lives with his brother and parents, in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Piseth is a third-year student, majoring in civil engineering at university in Phnom Penh. In addition, he is also employed for a company.

He wants to continue his studying. That is why he decided to apply for a loan, which he will use to pay his tuition.

loans.use: To pay university tuition, for his civil engineering studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia se dedica al negocio de venta de frenos para carros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frenos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar frenos para carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Julia has a business selling car brakes.  She works from 8am to 6pm.  She has done this work for many years and it is going well.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase car brakes.  She is happy to receive this loan and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase car brakes.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for his farm. He earns better income from this, always improving his farm.

He has bought a motorcycle, to use for carrying his produce and for providing transportation services. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC, which he will use to purchase new tires for his motorcycle. He is hoping to gain more profits from the farm, because he invested more and works diligently. Ruben wants to provide a better life for his family, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his motorcycle, which he uses in his farming and transportation businesses

loans.name: Clodenia

texts.en: Clodenia has been working on her farm with her husband. She raises pigs to add to her income. She has been a GDMPC member for three years and has borrowed a loan to buy feeding supplies because she wants to boost her pigs. She plans to buy more piglets to raise for her piggery business. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. She has an apartment for additional income. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams that all her children will have their own businesses. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. She also raises pigs to sell and she earns additional income from this business. Recently, Tita joined GDMPC and she gained access to financial services . She took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and new seeds of eggplant, ampalaya and pechay to plant. She wants to have a better life in the near future with her family..

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and eggplant, ampalaya and pechay seeds to plant

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a Cameroonian, 37 years old and single with three children. The oldest child is 16 years old and in secondary school while the youngest is 10 and in primary school. She has been in this business for over three years, which makes her very experienced. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase her profit from 12 percent to 20 percent.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer for resale

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María es una persona de 39 años de edad, Unido, quien tiene siete hijos, cinco varones y dos mujeres quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá.El se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas de ciclo corto (Cebolla, papa y zanahoria), esta actividad lo ha practicado durante varios años, experiencia que ha heredado de su padre, la producción lo comercializa a nivel regional, eligió esta actividad debido a que obtiene ganancias a corto plazo y con esto ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas (Semilla de cebolla y fertilizante orgánico). El sueño que tiene es remodelar sus habitaciones y tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en: José María is 39 years old.  He has 7 children, 5 boys and 2 girls, and they live in the department of Sololá.  He farms short cycle crops (onion, potatoes, and carrots). He has done this work for many years, and learned it from his father.  He sells his crops at the regional level.  He decided to do this work because he can earn money quickly and use it to support his family.  He is requesting a loan of Q 3,000.00 to purchase agricultural supplies (onion seeds and organic fertilizer).  His dream is to remodel his rooms and have a decent home.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (onion seeds and organic fertilizer).

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn, 36 years old, lives in Bakan district, Pursat province. She has been working as a farmer for many years and she can earn a decent income in an effort to pay for her family’s daily expenditures. Savorn is a mother of two unmarried children.

Savorn is a first time Kiva client, and now she really needs a package of money to build a hygienic latrine, which she never has never had before. 

She strongly hopes that this latrine will help improve her family’s sanitation and health conditions.

Finally, she is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than the usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1960. She lives with her children in north Tajikistan. Hanifa is widowed. Her husband died some years ago. She is the only breadwinner for her two sons. Hanifa and her children live poorly. She has been busy preparing and selling salads. She has managed this business for more than 14 years. Hanifa has great experience in this field.  She sells her products in a local market where she has regular customers. She is going to increase her working capital to produce more salads. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy vegetables to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to make salads to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy more education equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Sabita is a 38-year-old lady with three children. The lady standing with her raised hand is Sabita. She lives in the Purusottam Pur village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started growing vegetables and paddy. She grows different types of vegetables in her field depending on the demands of her customers and the season.
 
The group is requesting a loan of 120,000 INR. Sabita will use her part to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is part of a group of eight members, all of whom are women who live in the same community. They named their group Maa Laxmi Self Help Group, which is located in the Bhadrak district of Odisha, India.

Sabita and the others group members are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for the same.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine.

loans.name: Violeta3 Group

texts.en:
Teresita is the featured representative of the group Violeta3. She and the other group members are best friends who left their homes in the Philippines to work in Lebanon in an effort to improve their families' living standards. Their loyalty to each other helped them come together to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua.

Teresita is a 47-year-old married mother of three. She had to leave her husband and children to increase her earnings abroad. She is happy where she is, but misses her family tremendously. Teresita is acquiring a loan that allows her to provide her family with extra financial assistance while she continues working. Her loan will be sent to her beloved family to cover some of their increasing living needs. She is the lady standing in the middle of the picture. The other members of the group in the picture are Sally on the far left, and Jeny on the right side.

loans.use: to cover her family's living needs

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna, age 31, lives with her husband, Chandan, age 32, and two children. They come from a small village in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district. They are both uneducated but know how to sign their names. She is a homemaker, and her husband is a cycle van puller. 

Her husband's earnings are insufficient for their family because the rickshaw he pulls is a rented one. To earn more income for the family, they made a plan to purchase a rickshaw van, but due to insufficient money, they couldn’t. Thus, Jyotsna decided to take out a loan and purchase a rickshaw for her husband so that her husband can easily earn more income and not have to pay any rent. They hope this business can be profitable for them because people use rickshaws for transportation purposes in rural areas to cover short distances. 

Jyotsna's dream is to make her family financially strong with earnings from the business. She and her husband give hearty thanks to Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Antheline

texts.en:
Antheline is a Cameroonian, age 26. She is single, with a child of one year. 

She has been in this business for over six years, which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will be use to increase her capital from 800,000 FCFA to 1,100,000 FCFA. 

Her turnover and profit will be increased as well.

loans.use: to buy stuff (sugar, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, soap, etc) to sell

loans.name: Justina Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Justina Andrea  se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Justina Andrea has a grocery store business. The member sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. The member works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. The member has had this business for 5 years now, and she does very well. The member's dream is to expand her grocery store business. The member is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The member is very happy with the loan and promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg Group

texts.en:
Rashmi is 39 years old and has two children. She lives in a small village in the Bhadrak district in Odisha, India with her husband and her children. A few years ago, she started a grocery shop where she sells rice, lentils, potatoes, wheat flour, onions, spices, soap, etc. She purchases these items in the town with the help of her husband. She sells a variety of products depending on the demands of the village. 

Rashmi is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as detergents, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafers, toilet cleaner etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting the loan with a group of 10 members who all are women who live in the same community. They named their group Maa Durga Self Help Group. They are located in the Bhadrak district of Odisha, India. Rashmi is very grateful for what she is receiving from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, biscuits, candles, electric bulbs, wafers, toilet cleaner etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 55 years old and married with two children; both of them are in school.

Romela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Romela has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirty years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Romela aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a salt-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tailoring and selling dried fish. Dinah is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy sacks and other paraphernalia for her salt-making business.

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks and other paraphernalia for her salt-making business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of firewood to offer for resale.

Myrna has been in this business for ten years. Myrna earns more income from selling bread.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to offer for resale.

loans.name: Viim Kom Group

texts.fr:
Mme TATIANA est la responsable du groupe VII KOM. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. Les  02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits  depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Mme veut s’acheter 12 douzaines d’habits.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne agrandir le champ de son activité et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tatiana is the leader of the Viim Kom group. She is well. She is married with two children. The oldest is 21 and the youngest 18 years old. Both of them attend school. She has four people depending on her.

Mrs. Tatiana has been selling clothes for 13 years. She buys her stock at a market in her sector. She plans to buy 12 dozen items of clothing.

Mrs. Tatiana would like to reinvest her profits in her business. Her goals are to widen the scope of her activity and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 12 dozen pieces of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, chicken-feet, etc.

loans.name: Maa Sata Bhauni Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Sata Bhauni Self Help Group is a group consisting of ten members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years ago, they were all facing poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop, where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of the members is Baanti, who was selected as their president. Baanti is a 47-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children, who are attending school. The lady standing with her hand raised is Baanti. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc., in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. 

Baanti has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir has cows. He has been in the animal-raising business for nine years. 

Zakir is married and has two children. His son is 17 years old. He graduated school last year and is preparing for University. Zakir's daughter is going to musical school. She plays the piano well. Zakir's lovely wife helps him on their family business. They are living at Alixanli village in the Fuzuli region, but they are IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from their home, which was is Fuzuli City. 

Today, Zakir needs a loan in the amount of AZN 1,300 (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he is planning to vaccinate newborn animals. 

In the future, Zakir wants to build a new stall for cows.

loans.use: to vaccinate newborn animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers/flip-flops to add to her current stock

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à TANAKABOUGOU un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame MARIAM assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women who average 36 years of age and 4 children each, and most of whom live in traditional families in TANAKABOUGOU, a village located in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd collaboration with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. Mariam grows groundnuts. She is the group member sitting first from the left in the photo. She will use her loan to buy one 50-kg sack of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, to a clientele consisting of men and women, cash or credit. 

Mrs. Mariam expects to earn an average profit of 73,000 FCFA per campaign. She will use part of her profits to repay her loan and the interest, and the remainder to help her husband with the household’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 20-year-old single man. He left his home country, Syria, to work in Lebanon to improve his  living conditions. Fidaa quit school at the intermediate stage, and began his own home decoration contracting business. He hasn’t faced many financial challenges in his business, and his three years of experience have provided him enough revenue to employ two workers. He is well known by his clients for his clean and reliable work.

Fidaa is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase new equipment for his workshop, which will improve the quality of his work. He also intends to repair his car, since it provides him with the transportation that is necessary  to expand and grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his workshop, which will improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Shahnazar

texts.en: Shahnazar and his wife have been married for 27 years. They have a child who is going to the first course at the Technical University. Shahnazar wants his son to be a good engineer, and he works hard to provide a good education to his son. Shahnazar has a store where he sells daily food products. A while ago, his fridge broke. To buy a new fridge, he needs a loan of 1200 AZN-Azerbaijan New Manat.  He hope that this aid will help him to develop his business. To all he says “Thanks Kiva organization and friends”.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à TANAKABOUGOU un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame DIARA assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, who average 36 years of age and who have an average of three children each. The majority of them live in traditional families in Tanakabougou, a village in the Sikasso circle (Mali's third administrative region).

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their third seasonal loan from Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loans have all been repaid in full. 

Within the Benkadi 3 group, Diara, who is sitting on the left in the photo, grows groundnut. With her loan she is planning to buy one 50 kilo sack of fertiliser and one container of weedkiller; she will also pay the labor costs for maintaining 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. She expects to make an average profit of 73,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her on the one hand to repay her loan and the interest on it, and on the other to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and weedkiller, and also to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
Jose es un joven emprendedor con 26 años de edad que vive en Chincha junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien trabaja incansablemente para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Agente de Seguridad en una prestigiosa empresa de Vigilancia y con el dinero que gana solventa los gastos de su hogar.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, más adelante piensa estudiar una carrera universitaria para poder trabajar en empresas internacionales. 
Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo brindado él podrá terminar de construir su vivienda y así poco a poco cumplirá su más grande sueño: “Tener su casita propia con todas las comodidades”.
texts.en:
Jose is a young entrepreneur, 26 years old, living in Chincha with his wife and young son who is his pride, and for whom he works tirelessly to provide a better future. For more than a year he has been working as a security agent in a prestigious surveillance company and with the money he earns he takes care of the household expenses.

He is a person eager to get ahead and improve his quality of life, and is thinking of later studying at the university so he can work for international companies.

Jose is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support provided he can finish building his house and thus little by little fulfill his greatest dream of having his own home with all the amenities.

loans.use: to pay expenses to finish building his house

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling salt in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dried fish-vending. Alma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of salt to sell.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of salt to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

Besides the food stall business, Mejumaa operates a tailoring business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase thread and cloth fabric for her business.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabric for her business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth works hard to support her family. Janeth is married and has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines.

Janeth requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

Janeth has been in this business for seven years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Alain

texts.en: Alain is a 30-year-old married Cameroonian with four children; the oldest is eight and in primary school while the youngest is one years old. He has been in this business for over five years, which makes him very experienced, stable and his business profitable. He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase his monthly turnover from three hundred thousand to five hundred and fifty thousand FCFA.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for resale

loans.name: Andre

texts.en: Andre is Cameroonian, married with a two-year-old child. He has been in this business for over a year, which makes him experienced. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase his capital from one million to one million two hundred and fifty thousand FCFA. His profit will also increase.

loans.use: to buy stuff (soft drinks, biscuits, soap, sugar, groundnut oil, etc.) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.name: Sabali 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   SABALI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KONTABOUGOU dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame TEMBA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   SABALI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sabali 1 group are married women, who average 38 years of age and who have an average of two children each. The majority of them live in traditional families in Kontabougou in the Sikasso circle (Mali's third administrative region).

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their third seasonal loan from Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Within the Sabali 1 group, Temba, who is standing on the far left in the photo, grows groundnut. With her loan she is planning to buy one 50 kilo sack of fertiliser and one container of weedkiller; she will also pay the labor costs for maintaining 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. She expects to make an average profit of 74,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and weedkillers and also to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Sabali 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   SABALI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KONTABOUGOU dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame MAFOUNE débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  SABALI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 63 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sabali 2 group are married women, who average 32 years of age and who have an average of two children each. The majority of them live in traditional families in Kontabougou in the Sikasso circle (Mali's third administrative region).

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their third seasonal loan from Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Within the Sabali 2 group, Mafoune, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows groundnut. With her loan she is planning to buy one 50 kilo sack of fertiliser and one container of weedkiller; she will also pay the labor costs for maintaining 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. She expects to make an average profit of 63,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and weedkillers, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the school tuition for her son

loans.name: Zulfy

texts.en:
Zulfy is widowed. She is a very hard-working and goal-oriented woman. She has experienced a lot of difficulties in life. She raised her daughter alone. Her daughter is married. 

Zulfy for more than 15 years has been busy with selling fruits in a local market. She sells all kinds of seasonal fruits.  Now she sells strawberries, cherries, apricots, etc. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. Zulfy is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy fruits for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fruits for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers/flip-flops to add to her current stock

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à TANAKABOUGOU un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame MARIETOU débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BENKADI 4 are married women who average 28 years of age and 2 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in TANAKABOUGOU, a village located in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd collaboration with the MFI. 
All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. MARIETOU grows groundnuts. She is the group member standing first from the left in the photo. She will use her loan to buy one 50-kg sack of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, to a clientele consisting of men and women, cash or credit. 

Mrs. Marietou expects to earn an average profit of 73,000 FCFA per campaign. She will use part of her profits to repay her loan and the interest, and the remainder to help her husband with the household’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa es una joven emprendedora, tiene 25 años de edad y viven en el Departamento de San Martin junto a su esposo.
Desde hace más de 1 año estableció una tienda de abarrotes, ofrece productos variados como gaseosas, cervezas, productos de primera necesidad, etc. 
También se dedica al alquiler de cuartos teniendo un ingreso adicional para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Computación y más adelante le gustaría estudiar otra carrera profesional.
Melissa está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con su apoyo ella podrá comprar mayor número de mercadería para implementar su negocio y así pueda tener mayores ingresos para que más adelante pueda cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Ampliar su negocio”.
texts.en:
Melissa is a young entrepreneur, 25 years old, living in the department of San Martin with her husband. 

More than a year ago she established a grocery store offering various products such as soft drinks, beer, staples, etc. She also has additional income from renting rooms to cover the household expenses.

She is a person eager to get ahead. Currently she is taking computer classes and she would like to study in another career field later.

Melissa is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she can buy more merchandise for her business and thus have better earnings so that later she can fulfill one of her greatest dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his taxi and help start small a general store for his wife to increase his family income

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with nine children, six of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Jumwa wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, tea leaves, and salt to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, tea leaves, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a widowed woman who has been blessed with six children, one of whom is in school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Masika has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ricel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ricel works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Ricel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

Ricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en:
Hripsime lives in Gyumri town with her parents and sister-in-law. Hripsime's brother is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and works hard to support his family financially. 

Hripsime herself runs a small design shop in the center of Gyumri town. She trades with a big variety of flowers and designing accessories. Hripsime is an enthusiastic and hard-working girl who does her best to support her family's living. The requested loan is very important for Hripsime to purchase supplies (flowers, design accessories) needed for her shop. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this young girl to continue her small business.

loans.use: to pay for supplies (flowers, design accessories) needed for her shop

loans.name: Oroberesoromandi Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIORA représente le groupe OROBERESOROMANDI. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a30ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 01 va à l’école. Personnes en charge 02.
Mme fait la poterie depuis 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans une région  du Burkina.
Elle veut s’acheter 30charettes d’argile.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne toujours s’acheter un  motocycle et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safiora represents the Oroberesoromandi group. She is in good health and is married and mother to five children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 18 years old; one of them goes to school. She has two dependants.

Safiora has been doing pottery for the past 40 years. She gets her supplies in a region of Burkina. She would like to buy 30 cart loads of clay. She would like to reinvest her profits in her business. She has a continual ambition to buy a motorcycle and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 30 cart loads of clay.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase car seat cover materials.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода жительница района Шаритус, ей 45 лет. Она замужем за животновода и воспитывает троих детей. Озода предприимчивая женщина. Она в течение 7 лет занимается торговым бизнесом на рынке района. Озода продает хозяйственные принадлежности, в частности веревки, ножи, розетки и т.д. Она опытная продавщица и знает как обходиться с клиентами. Она хочет расширить деятельность и поэтому запрашивает кредит, поскольку собственного сбережения не хватает. Озода планирует увеличить ассортимент хозяйственных товаров, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов в свою лавку. Этот кредит ей очень нужен для развития торговли.
texts.en:
Ozoda is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is 45 years old. She is married to a livestock breeder and raising three children. Ozoda is an industrious woman. For a period of 7 years she has had a retail business at the regional market. Ozoda sells household goods, such as ropes, knives, sockets and so on. She is an experienced retailer and knows how to deal with customers.

Ozoda would like to expand her business, and therefore she requests a loan, as her own savings are not enough. She plans to increase the assortment of household goods, in order to attract more customers to her stall. She needs this loan for the expansion.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of household goods for increasing her sales turnover

loans.name: Sabali 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe   SABALI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KONTABOUGOU dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame KOROTOUMOU débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  SABALI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 63 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The nine members of the group SABALI 3 are married women who average 29 years of age and 2 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in KONTABOUGOU, in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd collaboration with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. KOROTOUMOU grows groundnuts. She is the group member standing second from the right in the photo. She will use her loan to buy one 50-kg sack of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mrs. Korotoumou expects to earn an average profit of 63,000 FCFA per campaign, which will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Dora Marisol

texts.es: Dora tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 12 años de edad y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para ganarse la vida y dar a su hija lo necesario. Dora solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso de su vivida para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, etc.
texts.en: Dora is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her twelve-year-old daughter. She has offered her services as a domestic worker for a long time. She is a hardworking, responsible woman who does all she can to earn a living and give her daughter everything she needs. Dora is requesting this loan fromo FUSAI to invest in improving the floor in her home. For this project, she will need materials such as bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and so on.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and other materials to install a brick floor in her home.

loans.name: Jacinto Andrés

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 25 años de edad y habita en  casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de un año de edad. Jacinto trabaja muy duro en una institución cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y llevar a su familia lo necesario. Jacinto solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un baño para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro.
texts.en: Jacinto is 25 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their little one-year-old daughter. Jacinto works very hard in an institution near his village, which allows him to make a living and meet his family's needs. Jacinto is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a bathroom, for which he needs materials such as bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Sabali 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe SABALI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KONTABOUGOU dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ROKIA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  SABALI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 63 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
NB/ Madame ANCHATA était absente lors de la prise des photos pour des raisons sociales.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Sabali 4 group are married women, who average 28 years of age and who have an average of two children each. The majority of them live in traditional families in Kontabougou in the Sikasso circle (Mali's third administrative region).

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their third seasonal loan from Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Within the Sabali 4 group, Rokia, who is standing on the far right of the photo, grows groundnut. With her loan she is planning to buy one 50 kilo sack of fertiliser and one container of weedkiller; she will also pay the labor costs for maintaining 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village in Sikasso to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. She expects to make an average profit of 63,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings. 

N.B. Anchata was, for social reasons, absent when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and weedkillers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en: Sylvie is a Cameroonian, aged forty-seven, married with five children. The oldest is twenty-six and in the university while the youngest is seven and in primary school. She has been in this business for over three years, which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her turnover from 975,000 FCFA to 1,225,000 FCFA. Her profit and capital will also increase.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, maggi, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: Hermenegildo es una persona de 37 años de edad, Unido, quien tiene siete hijos, cuatro varones y tres mujeres, quienes vive en el departamento de Sololá. El se dedica a la producción y comercialización de hortalizas en especial el cultivo de papa, zanahoria y repollo debido que a nivel regional son demandados y por ello el precio incrementa dando una ganancia aceptable, eligió esta actividad por heredad de su padre que con mucha experiencia le transfirió los conocimiento técnicos para poder obtener los rendimientos adecuados de cosecha, además se dedica al comercio dentro de sus comunidad mejorando sus ingresos económicos. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas especialmente semilla de papa, así poder ampliar su producción. La meta que tiene a corto plazo es poder darle a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias (Vestuario y mejorar la vivienda) para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is 37 years old, joined, has seven children, four boys and three girls, and lives in the department of Sololá.

He works in the production and marketing of vegetables especially growing potatoes, carrots, and cabbages, because on a regional level there there is a demand for them and therefore higher prices offering an acceptable profit. He chose this activity as an inheritance from his experienced father who taught him the technical knowledge to obtain a good harvest yield. He also is engaged in trade within their community improving their income.

He is asking for a loan of 4,000 quetzales to buy agricultural supplies especially potato seeds thus expanding his production. His short term goal is to give his children the necessities (clothing and better housing) to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potatoe seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Idalia Esther

texts.es:
Hace 11 años, ella era ama de casa, era quien cuidaba de su hogar y de su familia. Ahora, Idalia, a sus 53 años, tiene su propio negocio, donde día tras día trabaja arduamente para seguir creciendo como comerciante de comidas. Desafortunadamente primaria fue el último nivel de educación, años después se convirtió en esposa y madre de 4 hijos, quienes ahora son independientes y que la apoyan, junto a su esposo, siempre que lo necesita. 
Todo inició cuando su esposo empezó a trabajar en un laboratorio, el cual sirvió como plataforma para vender la comida a sus compañeros de trabajo, hasta llegar donde están con una gran cantidad de clientes. Además de trabajar por las noches como sastre.  Idalia espera seguir creciendo, para ello necesita de un préstamo, pues piensa comprar arroz, aceite, maíz, entre otros producto, por mayor para obtener un bueno precio, con mayores y mejores ganancias. Esto le permitirá cumplir su meta de seguir creciendo e innovando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Eleven years ago, Idalia was a housewife, looking after the home and the family. Now, at the age of 53, she has her own business, where she works hard day after day in order to grow her food-sales business. Unfortunately, she only received schooling up to primary level. Years later, she became a wife and the mother of 4 children, who are now independent and who help her, together with her husband, whenever she needs it.

Everything began when her husband started working in a laboratory. This became a platform for selling food to his work colleagues until they reached their current status, with lots of customers. As well as working at night as a tailor, Idalia hopes to continue growing her business, but for this she needs a loan. She is planning to buy rice, oil and corn, amongst other produce, at wholesale prices to achieve a better selling price with bigger and better profits. This will allow her to achieve her goal of continuing to grow and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy produce such as rice, oil and corn.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala is a 41-year-old housewife from the remote village Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Together with her husband, she is raising five children (three sons and two daughters). Two of their daughters go to the village school, but their sons are engaged in laborer works to earn money for the family. Due to their poverty, Mala could not send all their children to school. They live in their own small house and face many difficulties.

Mala’s husband runs a grocery shop in their locality. He purchases varieties of grocery items and products needed for his business from the wholesale market and sells them in his shop. Mala assists her husband in his grocery shop after managing her all household work. But nowadays, Mala's husband is facing the problem of growing prices of essential commodities. So it is hardly possible for him to run the grocery shop. Due to lack of capital, he cannot purchase more stock and varieties of groceries.

Mala has decided to help her husband and has taken out a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (Kiva's partner) to expand their business. With this loan, she wants to purchase varieties of grocery items, such as rice, oil, biscuits, lentils, flour, spices, soft drinks, etc., to add to her inventory. By increasing the variety of grocery stock, she hopes to attract more customers and earn more profit from their business. The profits from the business will definitely help to meet her family's daily needs and her daughter's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mala and her husband are very much grateful to the lenders of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for a grocery shop.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Servicio de cibercafé, minuto a celular, impresiones, fotocopias, scanner y tramites por internet son algunos de los servicios de la microempresa que el señor José ha logrado constituir con la ayuda de los microcréditos, su negocio lo tiene hace 10 años y desde entonces y con ayudas micro financieras ha logrado mantenerse en el mercado prestando un servicio de entretenimiento e investigación a niños jóvenes y adultos que carecen de internet en sus hogares, el negocio básicamente lo trabaja comúnmente solo pero en ocasiones una persona le colabora medio tiempo. 
En busca de fortalecer su negocio solicita un crédito para comprar equipos de cómputo y ampliar su capacidad, también quiere comprar insumos de papelería para ofrecer un servicio bien completo y que los clientes encuentren casi todo a la mano. Su único sueño es mantener su negocio ya que a sus 52 añso de edad es difícil conseguir empleo, solo quiere vivir tranquilo rodeado de sus clientes y familiares
texts.en:
Señor José runs a small cybercafe that he established ten years ago with the help of microloans. He also offers cell phone minutes, printing, photocopies, scanning, and internet transactions, among other services. Microlans have also  helped Señor José stay in business and offer entertainment and research services to young children who don't have internet access at home. Señor José usually runs the business by himself, but occasionally has someone help him half-time.  
 
Seeking to strengthen his business, Señor José is applying for a loan to purchase computers and expand capacity. He also wants to purchase stationery supplies so that he can offer more complete service and his customers will find everything they need at his cybercafe. Señor José's only ambition is to stay in business because at 52 years old, it's difficult for him to find work. He aspires only to live a quiet life surrounded by his customers and family members.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment and stationery supplies to offer more complete

loans.name: Patricia Yanet

texts.es:
Patricia inicio la venta de variedades específicamente accesorios hace años atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, busco esta actividad como un alternativa de generar dinero ya que su situación sentimental es actualmente divorcia y como mujer pujante, verraca pero ante todo delicada y bella busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos de 12 y 14 años, debido al alza de los precios de la canasta familiar, del arriendo, gastos escolares Patricia se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos y es por este motivo que necesita un crédito que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta, solicita un crédito para la compra de billetería y lociones para añadirlos a su portafolio de servicios. 
Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén y sabe que esta pro buen camino.
texts.en:
Patricia started selling a variety of items, especially accessories, several years ago. She learned how to be a saleswoman from a friend and has used it as a way to earn money. She is currently divorced and is a brave and beautiful woman in her prime. She is desperately looking for a way to support her two children, who are 12 and 14 years old. Thanks to the rising cost of staple goods, rent, and school fees, Patricia needs to increase her earnings, so she is requesting a loan to help her improve the variety of products she has available for her customers as she sells door-to-door. She is asking for a loan to buy wallets and lotions to add them to her offerings.
Her main dream is to be able to open her own shop, and she knows she's moving toward that goal.

loans.use: to buy lotions and wallets to expand her portfolio of services and have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La señora Sabina tiene 49  años, casada  tiene tres hijos de las edades de 10,15 y 18 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de variedad de dulces, galletas y refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Taruma de la  ciudad Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Sabina va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como dulces, galletas y variedad de refrescos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su puesto de venta ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la señora Sabina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio que venden los mismos productos que ella vende, la señora Sabina va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Señora Sabina is 49, married, and the mother of three children, ages 10, 15, and 18. She runs a business selling a variety of candy, cookies, and soft drinks from a small shop in her home in the Taruma section in the city of Santa Cruz. 

This is Señora Sabina's first loan from the institution, and she will purchase merchandise to stock her business: candy, cookies, and soft drinks. Demand at the shop has been strong, prompting Señora Sabina to apply for this loan. She faces challenges in running the business, such as competition from many local stores that sell the same products as she does. Señora Sabina will use the loan funds to purchase merchandise so she can keep growing her capital and expand her shop into a grocery store. This has been one of her ambitions, and Señora Sabina is grateful to the opportunity that lenders are providing her.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of candy to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Claudia Cristina

texts.es:
Solo un verdadero héroe se puede reponer de una gran caída y es que para Claudia no fue nada fácil reponerse de una grave lesión en su pierna que la dejo más de un año sin caminar y para la cual  tuve que tener una cirugía.
La señora Claudia se dedica a la fabricación de trapeadoras, recogedores y escobas negocio que aprendió de una empresa donde hacia trabajos similares  y está sacando un buen promedio semanal de producción pero presenta un grave problema y es que sus productos los entrega a domicilio y como es pro cantidad, la mercancía pesa y es muy malo para su pierna, por esta razón solicita un crédito la compra de materia prima para fabricar un mayor volumen de mercancía con la que pueda contratar a una persona para que le colabore. 
Claudia tiene un humilde sueño el cual es ir creciendo con su negocio poco a poco dando pasos cortos pero firmes en busca de una estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Only a true hero could recover from a serious fall, and nothing about Señora Claudia's recovery from a serious leg injury that required surgery and left her unable to walk for over a year was easy.   

Claudia has a business making mops, dustpans, and brooms, skills that she learned working in a similar business. Claudia's average weekly production is strong, but she faces a serious problem: she brings the products that she's made home, and although it's great to produce a high volume of goods, carrying the weight is terrible for her leg. Claudia is therefore applying for a loan to purchase raw materials that will allow her to increase production further and allow her to hire someone to help her. 

Claudia has a simple dream: to keep growing her business slowly, taking short but firm steps towards financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making mops, brooms, and dustpans.

loans.name: Shirley Violeta

texts.es:
Shirley es una joven emprendedora, con 18 años de edad, vive en Chiclayo junto a su conviviente y su pequeño hijo por quien día a día lucha para poder brindarle una buena educación.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Cajera en una tienda comercial y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y respeto.
Shirley está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con su apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar un juego de sala, para que su familia sienta mayor comodidad dentro del hogar y así mejore su calidad de vida. De esta manera, con el arduo trabajo que ella hace más adelante espera cumplir su mayor sueño: “Tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa”
texts.en:
Shirley is a young entrepreneur, 18 years old, and lives in Chiclayo with her partner and her young son for whom she struggles day after day to be able to offer him a good education.

She is a person who is eager to get ahead. She has been working for more than a year as a cashier in a retail store and is doing well because she is a very responsible person who serves her customers with kindness and respect.

Shirley is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their provided support she can buy a living room set, so her family will feel more comfortable in the home and thus improve their quality of life. So with hard work she hopes to later fulfill her greatest dream of having her own business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy a living room set to furnish her home

loans.name: Abrar Ghalil Group

texts.en:
This group is called Abrar Ghalil and consists of four women who are all hard- working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 130,000 YER. 

Aisha is 27 years old and is a married woman with three children. She is an uneducated woman, but she knows her advantages very well. She has a strong determination to improve her standards of living. She said she had a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Aisha invested that money in her own business. She started her business one year ago selling sweets in order to help her husband with the expenses of the family. She sees this business as a profitable for her. In order to expand further, Aisha requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sweets to resell to the children in her area.

Aisha expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through selling more of kinds of sweets.

loans.use: to purchase more sweets to sell to the children in her area.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente 13 años, en busca de una mejor oportunidad de vida para sus dos hijos ya que junto a su esposo conforman una humilde familia que ve centrada toda su preocupación en sus dos hijos,  se dedica a la venta de mercancía, frituras como chicharrones, papas, y platanitos los cuales son muy pedidos por sus clientes tanto así que para cubrir la demanda tiene que recurrir  a un tercero, los distribuye en la terminar de transporte de su municipio lo que es una gran ventaja ya que muchos pasajeros comprar para tener algo que comer en el viaje, trabaja junto a una persona con la cual dividen sus ganancias. 
Como toda mujer tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida como comprar su casa propia, hacer que su negocio crezca cada día más y quizás muchos se rían de sus sueños viendo lo que hace pero ella se siente orgullosa de esa profesión pues es con la que ha logrado sacar a su familia a delante. Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía par a no tener que recurrir a terceros pues le está quitando utilidad a sus ventas
texts.en:
Rosalba started her business about 13 years ago, in search of a better life for her two children. Together with her husband, they are a humble family who focus their attention on their two children. She works selling fried food such as chicharrones (a sort of pork crackling), potatoes and plantains, which are very popular with her customers. In order to meet demand, she has to use another person. She distributes the food in the bus terminal in her town, which is a big advantage because lots of passengers buy things to have something to eat for the journey. She works with another person, with whom she shares the profits.

Like all women, she has great aspirations in life such as wanting to buy her own house and making her business grow every day. Perhaps many would make fun of her dreams, considering what she does, but she feels very proud of this job, because it is this that has enabled her to help her family get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies so she doesn't need to call on third parties, as this is reducing profit from her sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies including chicharrones (a sort of pork scratching), plantains and potatoes.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married and has six children, five in school and one underage. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over seven years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Las Pankaritas" Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS PANKARITAS Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres que se dedican a  distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Carmen tiene 30 años y un  hijo de la edad de 7, años que se encuentra en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de lana como chompas en su tienda que se encuentra por la populosa  zona de la 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de chompas por mayor para surtir su tienda ya que esta época de frio tiene mucha demanda de sus productos razón por la cual solicito el credito, la señora Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y también agradecida por la ayuda a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Pankaritas is made up of eight members, all women who work in various activities. Carmen, is the president of the bank. She is 30 years old, and has a seven year old son, who is school age.

She works selling wool clothing such as sweaters in her store located in the busy 16th of July area of the city of El Alto.
