The purpose of the loan is to buy  sweaters to supply her store as this is the cold season when there is a lot of demand for her products which is why she asked for the loan.

Carmen is a hardworking person with years of experience in this activity. She is very grateful to the institution for the support given to her as this is the only activity with which she supports her family and she also is grateful for the support of the other members of the group who in many cases are supporting their families alone.

loans.use: to buy wool sweaters and vests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some seeds and other materials to prepare for the planting season.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Nasanjargal is a married borrower from the Uvs province of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his children in his own fenced-in land. His wife works with him and they drive around the province to sell their clothing. His oldest son is running his own business and 2 other children are studying in Ulaanbaatar city.

Nasanjargal is running a clothing business with his wife. They drive around to places and different cities and provinces to sell their clothing. They import their clothing or products from Erlian, China. They run their business at any season of the year.

He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to import summer clothing from Erlian, China to provide affordable clothing to local residents.

loans.use: to import summer clothing from Erlian, China to provide affordable clothing to local residents

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more bags of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over five years, she has operated a water selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season.

With the loan, she wants to purchase water pipes and to repair a leaking tap for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and to repair a leaking tap for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of coal

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and blessed with one school-going child. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Beatrice has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gent's suits for sale at home. She cites stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Rinku

texts.en:
Rinku is a hardworking woman. She is only 22 years old, and a housewife. She is the mother of three daughters. Her husband is Sijan, aged 30 years, a painter by profession. They live in the small village of Tekatuli in the small town of Maynaguri, district Jalpaiguri, in their own small house.

Rinu’s husband usually paints almirahs (free-standing cupboard or wardrobe), fridges, doors, windows, etc. in his villages. Rinku manages the household work and assists her husband in his work. 

The business of her husband is running well, but now they want to grow their business. Their customers are increasing day by day. Now they want to buy a spray-painting machine to attract more customers, but they lack capital. Rinku heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan of 8,000 INR.

Now, Rinu and her husband hope to earn more profit from their business. She and her husband give hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy a spray-painting machine for the painting business.

loans.name: Nirati

texts.en:
Nirati, 21 years, is a young rural woman who lives in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw and wood) with her husband, Bimal, and two children (two daughters). One goes to school, and the other daughter is too small to go to school.   

Nirati is a housewife.  Her husband is engaged with agricultural activity. He is the only earning member of the family.  

Nirati is a very enthusiastic and optimistic woman. Now Nirati decided to start a milk supply business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a dairy cow. She plans to sell the cow’s milk from door to door to her neighbors. There is a good demand in their locality. This will allow her to generate a good income to take care of her family and meet the educational expenses of her child.

Nirati dreams to build a cow shade and purchase more cows with the profit generated from the business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Metleb

texts.en:
Metleb is 49 years old and has been married for 19 years.  He has two children and both of them are going to secondary school. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land in Fuzuli city and now live in the Fuzuli region.

Metleb has a fruits and vegetables store. Today he wants to increase his business and therefore he has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables for selling. Metleb says thanks to the Kiva organization for aid.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: Doña María Lucrecia es comerciante de venta de lácteos, con esfuerzos de mucho trabajo logro sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes hoy en día trabajan y estudian, ella requiere el crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando crema, quesillos, queso, cuajada para ofrecer a su clientela variedad así mejorar sus ingresos, con la esperanza de que en un futuro pueda poner una tienda de ropa.
texts.en: María Lucrecia sells dairy products. By means of very hard work, she managed to raise her children, who are now working and studying. She needs the loan to invest in her business and buy cheese, cream, quesillo (a regional cheese) and curds to offer her customers variety and thus improve her income. She hopes that this means she can open a clothes shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy cream, cheese, quesillo (a regional cheese) and curds.

loans.name: Salika

texts.fr:
Monsieur SALIKA est né en mars 1975 à BLA, marié, père de 8 enfants il réside avec ses épouses et leurs enfants chez son feu père dans une fammille tradionnelle à OUAYERMA II  un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur SALIKA  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié aux activités d’achat et vente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) des radios et des téléviseurs. Il mène son activité au grand marché où il dispose d’une boutique. Monsieur Salika est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ 2 ans avec qui il est a son deuxième prêt individuel. 
Avec ce deuxième prêt, il compte acheter 6 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 2 radios de marques différentes, 1 téléviseur, 2 cartons de façade, 10 chargeurs, 2 paquets de carte mémoire, 2 grosses montres, 3 cartons de batterie et 1 douzaine d’écouteur. 
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Salika was born in March 1975 in Bla. He is married, father to eight children and he lives with his wives and their children in a traditional family at his late father's home in Ouyerma II, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Having had many unsuccessful business ventures, Salika began buying and selling cell phones and accessories (covers, batteries, chargers, headphones, etc.), as well as radios and televisions. He carries out his business at the Grand Market where he has a shop. Salika is in great demand from his customers for the quality of his products. With a view to increasing satisfaction of his ever-growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, around two years ago, and he is on his second individual loan. With this second loan he is planning to buy six cell phones of varying brands, two radios of different brands, one television, two cartons of cell phone covers, two packs of memory cards, two large watches, three cartons of batteries and a dozen headphones. He gets his supplies in Bamako and sells his products retail to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. 

He expects to make a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, which will be used to expand his business, to contribute to family expenses and to repay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories, radios and televisions.

loans.name: Yamb Yel Benewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme  TENE  est responsable du groupe  YAMB YEL BENEWENDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgés à 10 ans. Les 03 vont  à l’école.
Mme  fait restauration (haricot) et vend de condiments depuis  plus de 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter  03 sacs d’haricot, 03sacs de riz et des condiments.	
Elle veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne toujours s’acheter  un motocycle et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tene is responsible for the Yamb Yel Benewende group. She is in good health, is married and mother to four children. The eldest of her children is 23 years old and the youngest ten. Three of the children go to school.

Tene has been preparing food (beans) and selling condiments for more than ten years. She gets her supplies in her area. She would like to buy three sacks of beans, three sacks of rice and condiments. 

She would like to save her profits and her continuing ambition is to buy a motorcycle and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of beans, three sacks of rice and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase secondhand minivan from Korea and start transportation business of his own

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, soaps, toothpastes, dishes, etc., in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more organic vegetable and fruit products to sell at her store

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio 63 años de edad,  es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable dedicado totalmente a la agricultura. El grupo familiar está conformado por sus 2 hijos  de 17 y 27 años de edad y una nieta de 5 años de edad. Sus 2 hijos le ayudan a realizar sus labores agrícolas de preparación, siembra, fertilización, cosecha y pos-cosecha de granos básicos.
Lucio siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que trabajaba junto con su padre, cultivando maíz, frijol y maicillo. Así con la ayuda de su papá a aprendido mucho sobre como tratar los cultivos y así poder producir más. Además,  posee 5 vacas horras que les da su mantenimiento para que cuando estén en producción pueda tener una fuente de ingresos y pueda sacar subproductos de la leche para mejorar la alimentación de sus hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 3 sacos de fertilizantes, una caneca de herbicida y también pueda pagar mano de obra para darle un buen manejo a los cultivos.
Su sueño es seguir cultivando granos básicos para la alimentación de sus hijos, pero además quiere en un futuro comprar más ganado y así poco a poco ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucio is 63 years old. He is a hardworking and responsible man totally dedicated to agricultural. His family group is made up of his 2 children who are 17 and 27 years of age and a granddaughter who is 5 years old. His 2 children help him with the farming work of preparation, planting, fertilizing, harvesting and the post-harvest of basic grains.

Lucio has always been dedicated to farming since working with his father growing corn, beans, and sorghum. So with the help of his father he learned a lot about treating crops so that they produce more. He also has 5 unbred cows that he maintains so that when they are in production he can have a source of income and can have the by-product of milk to improve the nutrition of his children.

He is asking for a loan from CrediCampo to buy 3 bags of fertilizer, a bottle of herbicide and also to pay for labor to give him good management of his crops.

His dream is to continue cultivating basic grains for feeding his children, but also wants to buy more livestock in the future thus little by little improving his earnings.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of fertilizers, a bottle of herbicide, and also to pay for labor to provide good management for his crops

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, a 33-year-old married mother of three children, has been operating a tailoring business for many years to help support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband worked alone for their family, they would not be able to meet the household expenses and the educational needs of their children. With her neighbors and the local community as her regular customers, Shazia is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. 

Shazia has now requested a loan of 40,000/- PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in order to meet increasing demand. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: María Elsi

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, es una comerciante, no posee ningún tipo de estudio académico ya que cuando era una niña sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, dado que eran muy pobres, ahora ella está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de los cuales están acompañados y ya no viven con ella solo vive junto a su esposo que también trabaja para sostener su hogar.

María es una mujer muy trabajadora dado que la vida no le dio oportunidades de superación, una amiga de su madre quien tenía un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras empezó por ayudarle a vender cuando tenía 20 años, hace 8 años empezó con su propio negocio con una venta de pupusas frente a la alcaldía de su pueblo y desde entonces está trabajando con su propio negocio del cual  ella vende hasta $70.°° diarios. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una plancha industrial y poder hacer un  mini cafetín,  ya que el que tiene actualmente es de lámina.

Ella tiene un deseo muy grande que quiere realizar desde hace varios años y que no ha podido cumplir y es construir su propio mini cafetín  donde estén todas las cosas que utiliza para la venta,  ya que actualmente todos los días tiene que levantarse a las 4:00 am para llevar la plancha,  el tambo de gas y las demás cosas y lo mismo hace por las tardes.
texts.en:
María, age 54, is a tradeswoman.  She hasn't had any type of academic studies.  This is because when she was young her parents didn’t give her the chance to go to school because they were very poor.  These days she is in a relationship and has two children who are in relationships.  They no longer live with her, so together with her husband, she lives alone.  He also works to support the household.

María is a very hardworking woman.  Since life didn’t give her opportunities for self-improvement, at the age of 20 she began to help her mother’s friend who had a stand selling fruits and vegetables.  Eight years ago she began her own business selling pupusas [a traditional treat] in front of the town hall in her village.  Ever since then, she has been working in her own business where she makes sales of up to $70.00 daily.

This loan, which she is requesting from CREDICAMPO, is to buy an industrial griddle and to be able to start a small café, because currently the one she has is made from sheet metal.

For a number of years she has had a huge desire to build her own small café, but she hasn’t yet made it happen.  There she could have all the things she uses for her sales, because currently she has to get up every day at 4:00 a.m. in order to carry her griddle, gas tank, and other things, and then do the same in the afternoons.

loans.use: to buy an industrial griddle and start a small café

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban  tiene 52 años, casado con dos hijos de las edades de 16 y 14 años, él es agricultor en la localidad de Konani de la ciudad de Cochabamba el siembra variedad de hortalizas y vende del productor al consumidor en el mercado de la localidad,  este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Esteban  va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que está por terminar su casita  y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua  ya sea para la construcción como para el uso de agua potable como para el baño, lavanderia y la ducha y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la localidad donde él  vive no cuenta con servicios básicos, el señor Esteban se siente muy feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar la construcción de su casa y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en: Esteban, age 52, is married and has two children, ages 16 and 14. He is a farmer in the Konani neighborhood in the city of Cochabamba. He plants a variety of vegetables and sells them straight to the consumer in a local market. This loan is the first he has taken out through the institution. He plans to use it to finish installing running water to his home. He is about to complete his small home and it's a lot of work to move the water, both for construction as well as for drinking water, bath water, laundry, etc. This way he can provide his family with greater comfort; the area where he lives cannot rely on basic services. Esteban is happy and grateful for the opportunity that has been given to him to improve the construction of his home as well as his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: bring water to his home for a bathroom and laundry

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is a 24-year-old lady. She is married and a loving mother of two children (one son and one daughter), and is from a rural village, Tekatuli, in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She studied up to grade ten. She is married to Dipak, 26 years old. 

Shefali's husband earns a living through farming to support his family members. He grows green vegetables, such as beans, chilies, bottle gourds, etc., and sells his products in the local market. Shefali also helps him in his work. 

Shefali is a very active lady who wants to help her husband. She has decided to start nut cultivation on their farmland. With that aim, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs to grow nuts. Nuts are a very profitable crop in their area.

She hopes to grow more income from this cultivation to improve their standard of living. She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs to cultivate nuts.

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es: Doña Maria se encuentra muy feliz y muy agradecida con Dios por todas las bendiciones brindadas, ya que con su primer financiamiento pudo comprar insumos agrícolas con los que pudo asistir sus cultivos de hortalizas (papa) y al mismo tiempo comprar semilla certificada para sembrar una nueva plantación para incrementar el volumen de producción, venta y por ende ingresos para su familia. Gracias a las compras de insumos que hizo ella pudo sacarle provecho a la producción de papas las cuales vendió a muy buen precio obteniendo un ingreso factible con el cual pudo salir de su compromiso a pesar del pequeño retraso presentado pues retuvo una pequeña cantidad ya que el precio en el mercado no era el mejor. Su primer financiamiento fue de mucha ayuda para que ella pudiese cumplir con sus metas y seguir trabajando, de forma que hoy en día ella solicita un segundo financiamiento con el cual comprara otra parte de insumos y podrá preparar más la tierra para tenerla lista y sana para estos próximos cuatrimestres.
texts.en:
Maria is very happy and very grateful to God for all the blessings offered, because her 1st loan enabled her to purchase agricultural inputs and boost her potato crop. At the same time, Maria bought certified seeds to sow a new crop and expand her volume of production, sale, and, in the end, the family's income.

Thanks to her previous purchases of inputs, Maria was able to expand potato production, and sold her harvest at a very good price, obtaining a reasonable income. She was able to pay off her debts, despite a minor momentary setback. She had to retain a small quantity [of potatoes], since market prices did not remain high.

Maria's 1st financing was of great help, allowing her to fulfill her goals and continue working, so much so that today she is requesting a 2nd loan. With this money she will purchase a new supply of inputs, and prepare more land to have ready and healthy for the next 4 quarters.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to boost her potato crop and to have more land ready for planting.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián de 54 años de edad, es  agricultor, logró estudiar hasta 2° grado, no pudo seguir sus estudios ya que sus padres no tuvieron la facilidad económica para seguir con sus estudios, ahora él está acompañado y de dicho hogar tienen un hijo el cual está casado y ya no vive junto a él.

La actividad que realidad Sebastián es el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, ya que también era agricultor, su padre cuando se dio cuenta que ya no podía cubrir sus gastos educativos tomo la decisión de llevarlo a trabajar  junto con él,  pues había que sostener un hogar y su hijo que era Sebastián era el mayor de todos los hermanos y recayó sobre él parte de la responsabilidad de sostener a toda la familia al lado de su padre y generar ingresos, desde entonces él se ha dedicado a el cultivo del maíz.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla, abonos, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos más, para cultivar dos hectáreas de terreno que su padre le ha heredado.  

Como todo agricultor él tiene planes a futuro,  uno de ellos es poder tener un buen cultivo de maíz ya que el precio de los granos básicos ha aumentado en un 50% más a como estaba cuando él vendió la cosecha del año pasado,  ahora lo único que necesita es preparar bien sus cultivos y poder vender a buen precio la cosecha con estas ganancias podrá pagar su crédito y también podrá reparar el techo de su casa,  ya que está en malas condiciones y sabe que esto lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito y con su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Sebastián, age 54, is a farmer. He studied through the 2nd grade, but could go no further as his parents did not have the economic resources for him to continue. He now has a life partner, and they have a son who is now married and doesn't live with them.

Sebastián's work is farming corn and beans, work that he learned from his father, who was a farmer before him. When his father realized he could no longer afford to send Sebastián to school, he decided to take the boy to work alongside him. They had to make ends meet, and since Sebastián was the oldest child, some of the responsibility for sustaining the family and earning money fell to him. He's been a corn farmer ever since.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy seed, manure, fertilizers, and other supplies that he needs to cultivate the two hectares of land that he inherited from his father.

Like every farmer, Sebastián has plans for the future. One is to have a good corn harvest. The price of staple grains has gone up 50% since he sold last year's harvest, so all that he needs is to prepare his harvest well and he'll be able to sell it at a good price. With these earnings, he can pay off his loan as well as repair the roof of his home, since it's in poor condition. He knows he can achieve all of this with the help of this credit as well as his own hard work.

loans.use: buy seed, manure, fertilizers and more to work his land.

loans.name: Sahnaz

texts.en:
Sahnaz is a 29-year-old married woman. She deals in a business selling cloth in her community.  She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Maria Mariela

texts.es: Maria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda ella podrá comprar insumos para poder elaborar chocotejas, como manjar blancao, mantequilla, leche,. chocolate, pecanas entre otros, ya que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos para el día de la madre y del padre, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ventas y podrá mejorar en su vengocio de venta de jugos, sándwich, entre otros; negocio que su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 3 años, por el cual lucha cada día para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Mejorar su negocio y poder darle una buena educación a su hijo”
texts.en: Maria is grateful to Kiva lenders as it is thanks to them that she will be able to buy ingredients for her chocotejas such as manjar blanca, butter, milk, chocolate, pecans etc. She currently has many orders for Mother's Day and Father's Day, and as a result she will also be able to increase sales of juices, sandwiches etc. The business is her sole source of income to help her 3-year old son get ahead. It is for him that she she works hard every day to realize her dream of improving her business and providing her son with a good education.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her chocotejas such as manjar blanca, butter, milk, chocolate, pecans etc.

loans.name: Tropang 1 Group

texts.en:
Elizabet is the featured representative of the Tropang 1 group. She and the other members of the group have been best friends since they determined to leave their hometown in the Philippines to work in Lebanon in an effort to improve their families’ living standards back home. They deeply trust each other, which influenced them to seek a loan with Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua. They believe the acquired loan will make a good impact on their lives and the lives of their families back in the Philippines.

Elizabet is a 37-year-old married mother of one. She is a caring and devoted mother who is determined to provide her child with better living conditions. She intends to send the acquired loan amount to her beloved family in Philippines, to support them in their living and cover some of the increasing living expenses. 

She hopes that one day she can join her family again and establish their own business in the near future. Elizabet is standing between her lovely friends, Luz, the lady at the right side, and Loyda on the left.

loans.use: to support her beloved family in the Philippines, and cover some of the increasing living expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make the initial payment on a store in order to begin a new path in life

loans.name: Digna Marivel

texts.es:
Digna de 52 años de edad,  es una vendedora,  estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela luego su madre falleció y ya no existió la posibilidad de seguir estudiando debido a que tenía que trabajar para ayudar a pagar los gastos de la casa, actualmente vive solo con su único hijo que está acompañado.

Digna todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar la venta para los niños que van a la escuela, ella tiene un cafetint en la escuela de su cantón, este centro educativo le queda a una distancia de 400 metros, entre los productos que vende están tostadas de plátano, sodas, jugos, golosinas, entre otras cosas más, esta actividad la ha  realizado desde hace 11 años aproximadamente.

Ella tiene un terreno que su padre le heredó, son tres hectáreas  que las trabaja su hijo, en el cual  siembra maíz y frijol y todo el pasto queda desperdiciado porque no tienen ganado.  Ahora necesitan su crédito para comprar un novillo para repastarlo y aprovechar el pasto, saben que será de gran provecho.

El sueño de Digna es poder tener su ganado con la ayuda de su hijo y sacar adelante su familia y esta compra de bovino abre las puertas a nuevas oportunidades de progresar y mirar más a fondo a una mejor vida con más opciones de superación y sabe que estas puertas de oportunidades solo se podrán abrir con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Digna, age 52, is a saleswoman. She studied through the third grade; when her mother passed away, she was unable to stay in school since she needed to work to help with the household expenses. She currently lives just with her only son and his partner.

Digna wakes up very early everyday to prepare her stall for the children going to school. She runs a small cafe in the neighborhood school, which is about 400m from her. Among her goods for sale are plantain chips, sodas, juices, candies, and more. She's been doing this work for about eleven years.

She also has some land she inherited from her father - three hectares that her son works. He plants corn and beans there, and all the forage goes to waste because they have no cow. She needs this loan to buy a heifer that she can put out to graze to take advantage of the forage, which she knows will be a great advantage.

Digna dreams of owning this cow, and with the help of her son she will get her family ahead. Buying the heifer will open new doors of opportunity for progress and a better life, with more options for improvement. She knows that these doors will only open with the help of this loan.

loans.use: buy a heifer to take advantage of their forage

loans.name: Jeison Alexis

texts.es:
Jeison es un joven hombre emprendedor que se dedica a la venta de productos de aseo, salud y aseo personal de la marca Amway, aprendió de una empresa que los capacitaron para vender dichos productos, tomo al decisión de vendes estos productos ya que siempre le ha gustado ser independiente trabajar su propio negocio por ello pide un crédito para la compra de productos de esta marca, los cuales distribuirá a sus amigos y familiares principalmente y luego ir de casa en casa buscando nuevos clientes. 
Jeison es una persona muy luchadora de la vida, una persona que se traza un sueño y lo cumple, hoy en día quiere consolidarse como empresario buscando a través de su esfuerzo y sudor  un mejor futuro para él y su familia
texts.en:
Jeison is an enterprising young man who sells cleaning, health, and personal hygiene products by Amway. He learned the work from a business that trains people to sell the goods, and he decided to take it up, since he's always liked being independent and working for himself. He is requesting this loan to buy Amway products, which he will sell to his friends and family at first, but then later sell door to door in search of new customers.

Jeison is a fighter in life, a person who follows his dream and achieves it. Today he wants to establish himself as a businessman, seeking a better life for himself and his family through the sweat of his hard work.

loans.use: buy Amway products to sell to his neighbors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and an industrial overlock machine.

loans.name: Gladys Amalia

texts.es:
Gladys es una simpática mujer dedicada a la venta de productos de bisutería como collares, pulseras y anillos en materiales como plata, platino y oro.
Es una mujer muy dedicada y emprendedora, siempre con un enfoque claro.
Esta actividad la desempeña desde hace 10 años y ha podido conseguir la experiencia suficiente para tener éxito en su negocio.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de joyas de bisutería para abastecer su inventario y poder calmar la demanda de artículos que actualmente tiene.
Ella desea poder tener un negocio rentable y sostenible que le permita gozar de muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Gladys is a kind woman who makes her living selling jewelry, such as necklaces, bracelets and rings in silver, gold, and platinum. She is dedicated and driven, and she has always maintained steady focus. She's been doing this work for ten years now and she's gotten enough experience to be successful at it. She is requesting economic support so that she can purchase jewelry and gems to supplement her inventory and settle the demand for the items she currently has. She hopes to have a profitable and sustainable business that lets her enjoy good earnings.

loans.use: purchase jewelry to stock her store and

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married with nine children who are adults. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Chizi has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides selling clothes, Mupa sells fish.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for resale

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus dos hijos en una humilde finca en zona rural de San Rafael, Antioquia. Ella es madre soltera y durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.
Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Diana is a woman with drive and perseverance. She lives with her two children in a simple house in the rural area of San Rafael, Antioquia. She is a single mother, and since the birth of her children she has used her strength and courage to help them get ahead through her own efforts. Diana earns her living raising and then selling the fattened pigs. She's been doing this for ten years so she could generate enough income to bring up her family.

Diana works every day since the pigs need cleaning out, feeding, and constant monitoring to ensure correct development and then sales. She is seeking a loan to buy balanced feed for the pigs thus providing her with the opportunity to raise them as well as possible. Her dream is to see her children get good jobs after receiving the best possible education.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, pepper, soap cartons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Demin Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  DEMIN sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame SALI  débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  DEMIN , fait la vente des poissons fumés. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  un sac de 50 kg de poisson fumé au près des pêcheurs et effectue ses ventes au détail  sur place à KAMALEN SIRAKORO à une clientèle composée  d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the DEMIN group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old with five children each.  Most of them live in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their tenth solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  Their previous loans have all been duly repaid.

Sali, a member of the group, sells smoked fish.  In the photo, she is the first woman from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 50 kilos of smoked fish from fishermen.  She resells her merchandise on a retail basis in Kamalen Sirakoro, and her customers are both men and women who pay her in cash and on credit.

Sali is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 36,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, and the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jonathan. The hardworking and determined father of four resides in Litein, a rural town in Kenya thriving in poultry, dairy and tea farming. For the past three years, Jonathan has been practicing farming. He makes ends meet by selling milk, meat, eggs and tea from his farm. He also holds a job that pays a sustainable monthly salary. 

When he is neither on the farm nor at work, Jonathan is busy offering transportation solutions to his community in order to make extra money to better take care of his family.
 
He enjoys and takes pride in selling produce from his farm. His biggest challenges, however, are weeding and seeking pasture during the dry season. 

Jonathan is seeking a loan to purchase a good quality dairy cow. This cow is going to produce 15 litres of milk a day on average.  With a litre going for Ksh 50, Jonathan will be generating enough income to comfortably fulfill his loan obligation and manage to save extra money. “Additional income will go to my children’s school fees,” Jonathan said.

With your loan, Jonathan promises to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ritesh

texts.en: Ritesh is 30 years old and lives with his wife, child and his parents. Ritesh works for the government as bus control and cultivates rice for extra income. He has been busy with rice cultivation for 10 years and is doing business with Seva MFI. Ritesh wants to save for a plot where he can build his own house. Previously, Ritesh got a loan from Seva MFI to buy a clutter plough, which he has prematurely repaid. He now wants to overhaul his tractor and approached Seva MFI again for funding. With a tractor that is in good condition, he can earn more and save for his house.

loans.use: To overhaul his tractor

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
At the age of 45, Khursheed is a married woman. She is keen to provide her family with a good standard of living. Some years ago, she started a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) for meeting their household expenses.  She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide them with good-quality food, clothing and health. 

In order to buy stock of grains, biscuits, oil and beverages, she availed her eighth loan of 45,000 PKR. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, biscuits, oil and beverages.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 31 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 6° grado en la escuela de su lugar de origen, luego tuvo que dejar de estudiar porque quien sostenía el hogar  era su padre, ella junto a sus tres hermanas tuvieron que trabajar para sostener su hogar.  Actualmente, está casada y tiene un hijo que está estudiando su  8° en la escuela, su esposo quien es un agricultor ayuda fuertemente a los ingresos del hogar.

María es una mujer muy trabajadora, posee una tienda en su casa, aprovecho de realizar esta actividad después de analizar junto a su esposo que en el caserío donde viven no habían tiendas,  entonces fue cuando decidió poner esa tienda hace tres años.  Ahora ella necesita surtir la tienda, necesita comprar unos estantes para colocar los productos de la canasta básica que ponen a la venta, ya que la demanda es cada vez más grande y necesita ampliar más su negocio.

María tiene en mente ampliar un poco más su negocio ella invertirá en la compra de azúcar, jabón, galletas, sodas entre otras cosas más y la otra parte del dinero la invertirá en la comprar de dos estantes para poder colocar los productos que tiene a la venta.

Ella tiene un sueño y es poder ampliar su negocio, ya que su esposo ayuda mucho con el aporte de algunos granos y verduras, porque él los cultiva pero ella necesita surtir más de  los productos antes mencionados y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito su negocio crecerá y podrá sacar para pagar la cuota de su crédito y lo demás para seguir invirtiendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old. She managed to complete grade 6 in her local school but then had to stop studying because her father was supporting the family on his own. She and her three siblings had to find jobs to help out. She is now married and has a son who is attending grade 8. Her husband is a farmer and  is a good provider.

María is a very hardworking woman who runs a store out of her house. She started the business three years ago when she and her husband noted that there were no stores in their village. Now she needs to stock the store and buy shelving on which to display the basic groceries that she sells. Demand for the items is increasing and she needs to expand the store.

María has in mind the purchase of sugar, soap, cookies, soft drinks etc. She also wishes to use part of the money to buy shelving to display the items. Her dream is to grow the business. Her husband is a big help as he brings to her the produce he grows: grains and vegetables. However, as well as these items she needs to stock the previously mentioned items. María knows that she will succeed in growing her business and repaying the money with the help of this loan.

loans.use: Buy sugar, soap, cookies, soft drinks etc. and shelving to display the items

loans.name: Al- Bardias Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Bardias. It consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.  

Nathira is a 24-year-old single woman who lives with her family in their own house in Taiz. She studied until Elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. She works in dressmaking and she is a very professional young woman in this business.  She earns good money from this business, but reality it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Her father is an employee in a private sector, but his salary is very small. Nathira's house lacks many home appliances, and most of them are very old. For this reason, Nathira is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more home appliances for the house.

Nathira looks forward to expanding her business by opening a dressmaking shop. She hopes to renovate her family's house from the inside. She plans to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase more home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Kenyereye Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe   KENYEREYE  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame AMIANATA  débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes   KENYEREYE  , fait la vente des poissons fumés. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  un sac de 40 kg de poisson fumé au près des pêcheurs et elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientéle pour la qualité de ses produits  qui seront revendus au détail  à KAMALEN SIRAKORO à une clientèle composée  d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the KENYEREYE group are married women and they are, on average, 31 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their sixth solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans have all been duly repaid.

Aminata, a member of the group, sells smoked fish. In the photo, she is standing first from the right.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 40 kilos of smoked fish from fishermen.  Thanks to the quality of the fish that she resells on a retail basis, she receives a high demand from her customers. She sells to both men and women and is paid in cash and on credit. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 26,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, and the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is still single with two children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kabibi has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, chloride etc. for resale

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is a 40-year-old man. He is married with five children, three of whom are attending school. He deals in welding as his major source of income.  He started his business in 2009 so that he could be able to get income to meet his family's financial needs. His major challenge is lack of enough capital to buy materials for the business. Godwin joined Ugafode to get financial assistance to complete his house since his business alone could not meet all his financial needs. He is therefore taking a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to complete his family's house so that his family members can have decent accommodations. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy building materials and hire labour to complete his family's house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is a hardworking woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past six months, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the supplies and organic fertilizers that his coffee farm needs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cassavas, bananas, plantains, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat is a 27-year-old married man. He is Palestinian and he is responsible for the expenses of his family. Since he has been living in a Palestinian camp where work sectors are limited, he decided to establish a small grocery shop eight years ago. At first, he faced the challenge of finding the right shop location to attract the largest number of clients. After finding a new locations, he has been able to build a good range of customers from neighbors to far away residents in the area. 

Izzat has successfully completed two borrowing cycles with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, which helped him and his business. He is now acquiring a Youth Loan to purchase more products for his shop for the upcoming summer months. In the next few months, he hopes to buy an ice cream and smoothie machine, which will allow him to diversify his merchandise and provide refreshing treats to his customers looking to cool off in the hot summer.

loans.use: To buy an ice cream and smoothie machine

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame NABINTOU  assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes   KOTOGNOGONTALA  , fait la vente des  pagnes wax réal . 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  4 pièces  de pagnes  wax réal, elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits  qu’elle revend au détail  à KAMALEN SIRAKORO à une clientèle composée  d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA group are married women and they are, on average, 39 years old with four children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their tenth solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans have all been duly repaid.

Nabintou, a member of the group, sells "réal" wax-print fabrics. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the left. She is planning to use her loan to buy four pieces of "réal" wax-print fabrics.  Thanks to the quality of the fabrics that she resells on a retail basis in Kamalen Sirakoro, she receives a high demand from her customers. She sells to both men and women and is paid in cash and on credit. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 16,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy wax-print fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has three school-going children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and makeup for resale.

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe LUMIERE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédants ont été correctement remboursé.
Madame SALIMATA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes LUMIERE, fait la vente des bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes dans la ville de SIKASSO.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe pour les revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée des femmes de ménage au comptant et à crédit. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the LUMIERE group are married women and they are, on average, 39 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their 12th solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans have all been duly repaid.

Salimata, a member of the group, sells firewood.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the right. She stocks up in and around Sikasso.  She is planning to use her loan to buy two truck-loads of firewood for resale at the market to a customer-base which mostly consists of housekeepers who pay her in cash and on credit.  Thanks to the quality of the wood that she sells, she receives a high demand from her customers.  She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Nora tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su padre y una hija de 14 años de edad. Nora se dedica a la prestación de servicios de domésticos y  de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Nora solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la cocina por lo que necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Nora is 37 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her father and her 14-year-old daughter. Nora makes a living as a domestic servant, and, through this work, earns a living and supports her household. Nora is applying for this loan from "FUSAI" as she wants to repair the roof of her kitchen. In order to carry out this work, Nora needs to buy corrugated laminate sheeting, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to improve the roof of her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as cold water, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has two school going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over one year, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a new client of the organization who has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX. He is an old man who hails from a rural area in Nyarushanje Rukungiri district. He carries out the goat trade as his main source of income and also has a retail shop as his second source of income. The purpose of the loan is to add capital to his business by restocking the shop with more merchandise in order to meet his customers' needs and also beat the competition in order to earn more income. He has been doing this for over 10 years. His dream is to expand his businesses and educate his children.

He thanks Kiva lenders for a job well done.

loans.use: to restock the shop with more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as soap, clothespins, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase home appliances for her own house.

loans.name: Juan Pastor

texts.es:
Juan tiene 58 años y es padre de 4 hijos. Vive en comunidad al norte de Nicaragua y desde pequeño está relacionado con la caficultura, actividad a la que se dedica y señala que ha sido herencia de sus padres. Ahora, este pequeño emprendedor maneja su finca bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal, y tener una mejor producción este año y con ello mejores ingresos para su familia.

Su meta es incrementar el área productiva de su finca, bajo un plan de manejo integral y con ello tener mayores rendimientos para dejarle a sus hijos una finca productiva.
texts.en:
Juan is 58 years old and a father to four children. He lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua and, since a young age, he has been involved in growing coffee. He continues to work in this trade, having inherited it from his parents. Now the small-time businessman runs his coffee farm under Fairtrade conditions.

This loan cycle Juan is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy fertilisers that his coffee crops need, and to have a higher yield this year. As a result of all of this, Juan will earn a higher income for his family.

Juan's goal is to increase production on his farm, in order to implement an integral management plan. He wants to increase capacity in order to leave his children a productive coffee farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers for coffee crops.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a new client of the institution. He is married with seven children. He deals in the goat trade as his major source of income, the business he has done for over ten years. He is taking a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to expand his business by buying more goats that he will later sell at a higher price to earn income. Herbert hopes to educate his children and meet his entire family financial obligation using the loan and sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es:
Rodolfo de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, es casado su esposa vende pupusas, son padres de  tres hijos que estudian y trabajan.

Rodolfo  es empleado en una gasolinera desde hace varios años, trabaja  de lunes a sábado, el domingo descansa,  su trabajo no le queda muy lejos el horario es de 5:30 a.m a 4:00 p.m.
  
El préstamo lo necesita para cancelar una deuda y cubrir unas necesidades económicas para su familia,de esa forma lograra cubrir una de tantas necesidades.

El objetivo de  Rodolfo es seguir trabajando y darles lo necesario a sus hijos para que ellos en el futuro sean profesionales y se ganen la vida por si solos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 44 years old and completed up to ninth grade at school. He is married; his wife sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas). The couple has three children who study and work.

Rodolfo has been working at a petrol station for a number of years. He works Monday to Saturday and rests on Sundays. Rodolfo's workplace is not far from home; he works from 5.30am until 4pm.

Rodolfo needs this loan in order to pay off a debt and to pay for necessities for his family; this loan will cover the costs of a number of necessities.

Rodolfo's goal is to continue working and giving his children what they need so that, in the future, they can have a profession and earn their own living.

loans.use: to pay off a debt and to pay for necessities for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and resell them to his customers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with three school-going children.

Mariam has operated a fuel and potatoes selling business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more fuel and potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jentrix

texts.en:
Jentrix is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is an old client of the organization, who applied for a loan of 3,500,000 UGX. He operates a spare parts business, which is his major source of income. He has operated his business for a period of six years, and his major challenge is limited capital, which affects his operations. He joined Ugafode for financial assistance to boost his business and increase the profits he gets from his business. Innocent is happy with Ugafode since it has enabled him to expand his business. He hopes that his business will expand more using this loan. He also encourages Ugafode to continue supporting low-income earners.

loans.use: to buy spare car and bicycle parts for his shop

loans.name: Edison De Jesus

texts.es: Al hablar de Edison no podemos obviar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de nuestro país. Edison no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor decidió montar una tienda para complementar sus actividad ya que encontraba mucho tiempo muerto y si hay algo que caracteriza a un agricultor es que no puede estarse quieto tiene que estar trabajando constantemente y es por esta razón que el señor Edison solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de su tienda, básicamente grano y abarrotes, snacks y dulces los cuales complementarían muy bien los ya conocidos productos que distribuye y que incluso vende lo que cultiva en su tierra, su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos para comprar el local donde actualmente opera
texts.en:
When speaking of Edison, we cannot leave out that he was born a farmer. He was raised and shaped with the beautiful values of the field, which are humility and hard work. These two are the most representative of farmers from our country. 

Edison was not satisfied with the income he obtained as a farmer. He decided to set up a store to complement his job, since he found a lot of free time and if there is something that characterizes a farmer it is that he cannot stay still and must be working constantly. It is for this reason that Edison is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his store such as basic grains, groceries, snacks, and candies, which will be great additions to the the products he is already known to sell. He even sells what he grows on his land.

His dream is for God to allow him to have good health so that he is able to work tirelessly and generate a good income to buy the store from which he currently sells.

loans.use: to buy a varied supply of groceries, grains, snacks, and candies to add to the products already offered in his store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 49 años de edad,  estudio hasta 7º grado,es madre soltera,el negocio que posee durante años es la venta de ropa y cosméticos en variedad, a ella sola le ha tocado crecer a sus hijos, el horario de atender su negocio es de 5:00 AM a 5:00 PM

El  negocio de ropa y cosméticos esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad.

 El préstamo lo utilizara para consolidar deudas y lo demás invertirlo en compra de mas mercadería como:Blusas,calcetas,faldas, cremas, lociones, cinturones, etc.

El sueño de  Rosa, es dejarles un medio de trabajo a sus hijos el cual es un negocio estable para que ellos se defiendan por si mismos y lograra también sus ilusiones y objetivos que se ha propuesto para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa, 49 years old, attended school until the 7th grade.  She is a single mother. She alone has been responsible for raising her children. 

For years she has had a business selling clothes and a variety of cosmetics.    She runs her business from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m.  Her clothing and cosmetic business is located in the city center.

She will use the loan to consolidate debts, with  the rest invested in purchasing more merchandise, such as blouses, socks, skirts, creams, lotions, belts, etc.

Rosa’s dream is to leave her children a means of livelihood, a business that is stable so that they can support themselves on their own.  She will also achieve the dreams and objectives she has proposed and her family will live better.

loans.use: to consolidate debts and purchase more merchandise, such as blouses, socks, skirts, creams, lotions, belts, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is an old client with the organization. He carries out cattle fattening, which he has done for over 26 years.  He took a loan of 3.000.000 UGX. He is a 50-year-old widower with five children, two of whom are still attending school. He hails from a rural area in the Rukungiri municipality. He took this loan to buy more cows for sale and to increase his income. His dream is to expand his business to greater heights. With this loan from UGAFODE, John is hopeful his business is going to expand.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Chuipachaj Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Chuipachaj (meaning “By the Trees” in the “Kiche” Mayan language) is happy and thankful to report that they have successfully concluded their previous loan cycle and are ready to begin a new one. They are most hopeful that KIVA lenders will again place their trust in the women, most of whom are weavers.

In the previous loan cycle, we shared a report on the President of the Trust Bank, whose name is Margarita. She is 39 years of age with two children. Thanks to her profits from her weaving business, she was not only able to cover the monthly expenses of the family but also able to send her daughter to college. This has been a dream for both mother and daughter. In addition, her son is enrolled in school. Margarita is requesting a new loan in order to purchase weaving supplies, including high-quality threads, for her business.

As she has been involved with Friendship Bridge for the past five years, Margarita has learned a great deal from the non-formal education segments of the monthly meetings. A Loan Officer from Friendship Bridge meets with the women and presents them with information about business management, budgeting and accounting, as well as information on children’s and women’s health and nutrition. Other topics include over-indebtedness and customer service. It is the combination of the loans and the non-formal education component that Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus."

Margarita and her fellow Trust Bank members send blessings and gratitude to KIVA lenders throughout the world. They want the lenders to know that the lenders are making a huge difference in their lives. They look forward to a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty!

loans.use: To purchase weaving supplies, including high-quality threads

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous loan, which allowed her to improve her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She stills operates a green grocery business. She is seeking this loan to purchase potatoes, onions, and green vegetables for re-sale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional vegetables (e.g., potatoes, onions, and greens) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which allowed her to improve her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income.

She is requesting this loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and other vegetables for re-sale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional fruits and vegetables (e.g., onions, tomatoes, and potatoes) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing food items such as rice, oil, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and fish with the loan.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a repeat client at the branch. He is married with seven children. All of his children have completed school. However, he has two grandchildren, both of whom are in school, so he pays for their tuition.

The cattle trade is his primary source of income. But his major business challenges are fierce competition and limited capital.

Therefore, he decided to join UGAFODE. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 UGX to supplement his capital and to be able to better compete in the market. Tadeo thanks UGAFODE for financial assistance, which has enabled him to educate his children. From now on, he is concentrating on expanding his business.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing cattle for trading purposes

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a repeat customer to the organization who has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy merchandise for sale in the retail shop. This 28-year-old man is married and blessed with three children. He hails from a village in the northern ward, eastern division, Rukungiri district. He operates a retail shop with a small bar as his major source of income.  However, he has been faced with limited capital and competition challenges that deter him from competing favorably in the market. He hopes with this loan from UGAFODE, his businesses will improve gradually and so will his income.

loans.use: To buy mercahandise to sell

loans.name: Rwakigaju Tukore Group

texts.en:
Herbert is a male adult and a member of Rwakigaju Tukore group made up of 6 members and they took a loan of 2,100,000. He is married, has 5 children,  and is a resident of a rural cell in Kashayo, Bugangari sub- County, Rukungiri district.   

He didn’t acquire enough education and he decided to engage himself in productive agriculture to be able to support his family. He later found out that the money from agriculture was not enough to meet all his family's financial needs and he joined Rwakigaju Tukore Group to borrow funds from Ugafode.  He is acquiring a loan to help him buy mulch for his banana plantation. He hopes this will increase his yields to better his agricultural business. 

He expects to earn more after investing this loan and he is grateful for the support offered by Ugafode.

loans.use: to buy mulch for this banana plantation

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is an old client to the organization who is securing a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. He is single and he takes care of his aged parents. He deals in cattle trade, coffee growing, and selling of seedlings as his major source of income.

Stephen joined Ugafode to get financial assistance to expand his business and make more profits from seedlings after he has fertilized his plantation.  His dream is to expand his business and hopes that with this loan from UGAFODE, his profits will increase. 

He is thankful to Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial assistance granted to him.

loans.use: to buy organic manure to fertilize seedlings

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Christopher, who is in his early thirties, is married with two boys who are still in school. He has been running a general store for eight years now.  He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Christopher's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock the out of stock items in the store and started showing video shows, football matches, etc. He is doing fine with the loan.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase the store inventory. He dreams of owning a whole sale shop. 

Christopher will share this loan with his loan group "Saranga", which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the store inventory.

loans.name: Classic Group

texts.en:
HUSNA, who is in her late twenties is single.  She has been selling bedsheets and fabrics for three years now.  

She works from 10am to 9pm daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be HUSNA's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling fabrics and bought more bedsheets which she sells door to door.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profits to save in her bank account and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more bedsheets and fabrics to resell.  She dreams of owning a big bedsheets shop.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group "CLASSIC". The two members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bedsheets and fabrics to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more traditional clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Al hablar de Luis podemos evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.
El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Tierra Alta, Córdoba donde convive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.
El se gana la vida con la compra y venta de leche y queso alrededor del municipio y tiene plena fe en su negocio.
Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar un bote de madera en el cual pueda transportar sus productos a través del Rio Magdalena que es el que conecta las veredas cercanas al municipio, adicional a esto requiere capitalizar su negocio para tener un amplio inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes al por mayor.
El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.
texts.en:
When speaking about Luis, we can make evident that he is a very hardworking and diligent man. Everything he does is for the good and well-being of his family. He lives in a humble house in the town of Tierra Alta, Cordoba, with his wife and their 5 children. He has fought to give them a decent live and a quality education. 

He makes a living buying and selling milk and cheese throughout his town, and has complete faith in his business. He is a hardworking and persistent individual who loves his children very much.

He is requesting a loan to buy a wooden boat in which he can transport his products through the Rio Magdalena, which connects the nearby villages to the town. In addition to this, he wishes to capitalize his business in order to have a large inventory available to sell to his customers at wholesale. He hopes to find help in people with a caring heart.

loans.use: to buy a wooden boat and a supply of milk and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and coal

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Nusfati, who is in her mid-twenties, is single. She has been running a business of selling cold drinks and electronic money transfer since 2013. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Nusfati’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy water, soda, juice and electronic money transfer credit. She dreams of having her business on an international level.

Nusfati will share this loan with her loan group; the two members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy water, soda, juice and electronic money transfer credit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Patricia
