texts.en: Patricia is a Peruvian artist and designer who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to purchase fine silver and natural gemstones. Patricia has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is her story: Patricia works with a number of crafts in regions throughout Peru. "My art is a personal search. I find nourishment in the art of our ancestors, the experience of master artisans, and the influence of international designers. Crafts are my life's passion." "I thank you all from the bottom of my heart for this microcredit. It's amazing to feel so supported, especially by people who appreciate the arts. Many thanks, and may God bless you." Use the link below to view Patricia's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/2752

loans.use: to purchase fine silver and natural gemstones for her jewelry

loans.name: Blema Tesaa Group

texts.en:
Theresa is a businesswoman who sells oil, groceries, slippers, and underwear. She has 12 years experience with this business, which has allowed her to get ahead. The income she receives from her business contributes to her well being. Her business is run through hawking and also at her home. Her main customers are people who live in the same community. She is asking for this loan in order to buy oil, groceries, and slippers to sell to customers. She dreams of having more stock for her oil, groceries and slippers business and having more customers.

She is asking for the loan as a group with Comfort, who sells underwear as her main activity and has 15 years experience. They need a total amount of GHS 2,100 to increase their businesses and they will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy oil, groceries, and slippers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy electric scissors, a generator, and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goods and buy a generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, generator, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, generator, and table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, over sewing machine, iron, and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Rezia Mae

texts.en:
Rezia Mae is 19 years old and is the oldest of three children in her family. She is currently in the second year of her four-year Bachelor of Science in Accounting Technology course.

Rezia Mae is borrowing 7,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15. She plans to be gainfully employed after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa, aged 51, is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She has been in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines for the past four years. 

Maria Theresa has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Maria Theresa would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, generator, and fabric.

loans.name: Michell

texts.en:
Michell is 38 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Michell has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Michell is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 58 years old, is married and has six children. She has been in the agricultural business in the Philippines for the past 18 years. 

Rebecca has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seedlings and other farm supplies for her farm.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and other farm supplies for her farm

loans.name: Hermosilia

texts.en:
Hermosilia is 49 years old and has seven children. Hermosilia is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Hermosilia is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Hermosilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

Hermosilia has been raising cattle for 15 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Hermosilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 18 years old and is the youngest of three children in her family. She is currently in the first year of her four-year Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education course. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Jennifer plans to be gainfully employed after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Grace has taken out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Grace is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 63 years old and has two children. She is widowed and has one child who is still in school. Cecilia has been involved in the agricultural business of fattening pigs in the Philippines which she has been doing for the past 12 years. 

Cecilia has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, aged 32, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Irene is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Irene can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Dalisan

texts.en:
Dalisan works hard to support her family. Dalisan is married and has a coffee making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional machine for her business.

Dalisan has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Dalisan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional machines for her coffee making business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling bananas and raising livestock. Joy is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to resell in her firewood vending business.

Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 42 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a selling plastic roping in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to resell.

Dolores has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of plastic ropes to resell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 66 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Corazon has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, cereals, juice, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc. 

Corazon has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of the items she sells: detergent, soap, shampoo, cereals, juice, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, soap, shampoo, cereals, juice, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Hailene

texts.en:
Ma. Hailene is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Hailene is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen products business in the Philippines. Ma. Hailene requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to resell.

Ma. Hailene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Hailene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen products to resell.

loans.name: Waren

texts.en:
Waren works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Waren would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is single and has a bamboo retail business in the Philippines.

Leny requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of bamboo to offer for resale. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Leny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bamboo to offer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sales cart and a selection of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to resell in her rice retailing business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a pre-paid mobile load retailing in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional prepaid load to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid load to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising livestock. Juliet is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to resell to her customers in her firewood vending business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Juralen

texts.en:
Juralen is 30 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Juralen works very hard to provide for them.

Juralen runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as detergent soaps, noodles, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, biscuits, candies, etc. to resell.

Juralen has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items, such as detergent soaps, noodles, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, biscuits, candies, etc. 

Juralen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as detergent soaps, noodles, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, biscuits, candies, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap

loans.name: Sotheavy

texts.en:
Sotheavy, 32, lives in a Phnom Pen suburb. She has been married since 2006 and has one son and two daughters. Her husband is a soldier.

Sotheavy is a rice farmer who rents her fellow villagers' land to farm. Rather than pay rent, Sotheavy wants to buy property and has decided to apply for a loan to purchase the neighboring land.

loans.use: To buy neighboring land to farm rice.

loans.name: Recardo

texts.en:
Recardo, 50, is very responsible with his household obligations and  has always provided the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and son. He is a farmer who plants rice and corn.

Recardo wants to increase sales and has requested a loan to purchase items such as seeds, compost and fertilizer, and to pay for land preparation and labor. This will enable him to continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and fertilizer and to pay for land preparation and labor.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 60 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Cresencia has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 38 years and also earns an income from ice cream vending. 

Cresencia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store.

Cresencia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora, aged 30, is married and has four children who are in school. She has been in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines, for the past 15 years. 

Dioscora has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

In the future, Dioscora would like to save enough money so she can afford to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Emma hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fernandita

texts.en:
Fernandita, aged 50, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. 

Fernandita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago es una persona de 43 años de edad, Unido, quien tiene siete hijos, cuatro varones y tres mujeres, quienes vive en el departamento de Sololá. El se dedica a la actividad agrícola, siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos  principalmente papa, zanahoria, repollo y maíz, eligió esta actividad debido a que su padre le heredo propiedad para cultivar y diversificar sus producción, y es donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y zanahoria y diversificar su producción. La meta que tiene a corto plazo es poder brindar a su familia vestuario y remodelar su vivienda, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santiago is 43 years old, is in a relationship and has seven children - four boys and three girls. They live in the department of Sololá. He works in agrículture, growing vegetables and basic grain, primarily potatoes, carrots, cabbage and corn. He chose this vocation because his father left him some land to cultivate and diversify his production. That is where he gets the greatest part of his income, with the goal of improving his family's conditions. 

He is requesting a loan of Q 2,000.00 to buy seeds for potatoes and carrots and to diversify his production. His short-term goal is to be able to provide his family with clothing and remodel his home, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds for carrots and potatoes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 32 years old and married with three children in the Philippines. She earns a living by fattening pigs and selling them. Margarita is borrowing  21,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margarita has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She works tirelessly toward her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She earns additional income from frozen food vending.

Gaudencia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell in her general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Gaudencia dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Larina

texts.en:
Larina is 57 years old, married and has three children. She has been in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines for the past 20 years. 

Larina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

In the future, Larina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 35 years old, married and lives at Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she takes in and raises goats from her neighborhood.  The goat owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise a goat on her own as well. 

Emma obtained the capital to purchase her original goat and its feed. Now, she requests a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase materials for an animal cage. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family.

loans.use: purchase materials for an animal cage for her goat.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 64 years old, married and lives at Poblacion, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. With a desire to earn more for her family, she decided to raise pigs on her own. 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) has supported her capital to purchase piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase animal feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Alba Del Carmen

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento doña Alba compro los insumos necesarios que ayudaron a dar una excelente protección y asistencia a sus cultivos de café, 17 quintales de urea, 15 quintales de fertilizantes 12-24-12, pago de mano de obra calificada para realizar la limpieza de maleza aplicación de abono entre otras actividades que dieron un excelente resultado al final de la cosecha. Ella se encuentra muy contenta y sobre todo agradecida con DIOS por haber cumplido con la meta propuesta que era la de poder mediante la compra de insumos agrícolas asistir sus cultivos de café ya que de esa manera evito que fueran contaminados por la roya u otra plaga que echara a perder su cosecha. Nuevamente Doña Alba solicita un segundo financiamiento con el cual asistirá la plantación de café ya que después de la corta del grano ella relata que la planta y la tierra quedo deteriorada y dañada esperando nuevamente poder ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA para seguir trabajando en la única esperanza de crecimiento y desarrollo para su familia e hijos.
texts.en:
Thanks to her first loan, Alba bought the necessary supplies that helped give her coffee crops excellent protection and assistance - 17 quintals of urea, 15 quintals of 12-24-12 fertilizer, pay for the qualified laborers to clear the underbrush and apply the fertilizer, among other activities. All this produced excellent results at the end of the harvest. 

She is very happy and above all thanks GOD for being able to reach her proposed goal, which was to be able to assist her coffee crops through the purchase of agricultural supplies. By doing so, she prevented their contamination with rust and other pests that would have caused her to lose the harvest. 

Alba is again requesting a second loan, which will assist the coffee plantation since after the beans were cut, she states the the plants and soil became deteriorated and damaged. She is hoping to again receive the support of the various investors en the Kiva platform so she can continue to work at the only hope for growth and development for her family and children.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies to aid and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Las Princesas Group

texts.es:
DENCI. Tiene 36 años vive en Borbón. Sus 3 hijos asisten normalmente a clases. Su esposo es mecánico y atiende en su propio taller donde dá trabajo a 3 personas.
DENCI se dedicaba a lavar ropa ajena y desde hace 18 meses se dedica a la venta de pescado frito en la acera de una calle en horas de la tarde.
Con este préstamo. Ella comprara una carpa, mesas y sillas. Además de materiales para la preparación del pescado. Desea también vender chuletas asadas por que los clientes le piden mucho.  Así servirá de mejor manera a sus clientes y a su comunidad. Ya con esto. Podrá brindar la oportunidad de trabajo a 2 personas más para que le ayuden en el negocio del pescado ya que es muy bueno y tiene mucha salida.
Los integrantes del grupo no son del mismo barrio pero se conocen desde niños tienen negocios independientes y cada uno recibirá $500.00 es la primera vez que hacen crédito y están seguros de crecer en sus negocios.
En un futuro no muy lejano cree haber obtenido ganancias considerables y comprar un terreno para poner su negocio de venta de pescado frito  y servir de mejor manera a su comunidad en un solo lugar.
Sus hijos varones desean estudiar la profesión de su padre (mecánico) y la niña desea estudiar informática y tecnología digital.
Agradecen a FODEMI por ofrecer pagos bajos con intereses cómodos para la gente pobre y agradecen que esta institución haya llegado hasta su comunidad porque esto no hace la banca tradicional.
texts.en:
Denci is 36 years old, and she lives in Borbón. Her three children regularly go to school, and her husband is a mechanic and works out of his own workshop where he manages three people. Denci has been working doing laundry for clients, and in the past 18 months, she has been selling fried fish on the streets in the afternoon. With this loan, Denci will buy a canopy, tables, and chairs along with materials to prepare the fish. She also hopes to sell grilled pork chops, which her clients have asked for many times, and which will allow her to be able to better serve her customers and her community. With this investment, Denci will also be able to offer work to two more people to help with the fish business, which is already very good and successful. 

In the not too distant future, Denci believes she can make considerable profits and buy a plot to establish her fried fish business and better serve her community from one location. Her sons want to study to become mechanics like their father, and her daughter wants to study computer science and digital technology.

The members of this borrowing group are not from the same neighborhood, but they know each other from childhood, and they all have independent businesses. Each one will receive $500 USD for their first loan, and they are certain it will grow their businesses. 

They are thankful to FODEMI for offering low payments with affordable interest rates for poor people, and they are grateful that this institution has come to their community because it is apart from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy a canopy, tables, and chairs along with materials to prepare the fish. She will also start selling grilled pork chops.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married with six children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. Evelyn has been running a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines for the past 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice. 

She has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. Evelyn has now requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Raul Arnoldo

texts.es: Raul tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa  y su hija de un año de edad. Raul trabaja como vendedor en una comercial cercana a sus localidad y ademas presta servicios de transporte dentro de su comunidad. Raul solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la cocina y además desea reparar el baño por lo que ncesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, arena, cemento y ladrillo.
texts.en:
Raul is 24 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 1-year-old daughter. Raul works as a salesman at a local mall nearby, and also provides transportation services within his community. 

Raul is requesting this loan from FUSAI because he wants to repair the kitchen roof and also wants to repair the bathroom. He needs materials such as galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, sand, cement and bricks.

loans.use: To buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, sand, cement and bricks to repair the kitchen roof and the bathroom.

loans.name: Ricardo Felix

texts.es: Ricardo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo y gracias a ello podrá compra bisutería de plata como aretes, anillos, collares, entre otros, ya que él se dedica la venta de bisutería y joyas de plata desde hace 5 años con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio.
texts.en: Ricardo is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva because this is the second time that they are offering their support. Thanks to their help, Ricardo will be able to buy imitation silver and other costume jewelry such as earrings, rings, and necklaces among others. He has been selling jewelry for five years, which is why he has earnings to be able to move forward with his family. Ricardo will keep fighting to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: to have his own storefront for his business.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as earrings, rings, and necklaces among other things.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa desde hace un año es socia del grupo de crédito El Paraíso, vive por una  comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, donde se encuentran  grandes fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas.
La Señora Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, es divorciada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres mayores de edad de los cuales dos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su ultima hija está estudiando en un colegio de la localidad, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, sus productos los vende y utiliza para el consumo de su hogar,  también cría animales como pollos y cuyes. 
Su nuevo crédito es comprar cerdos para incrementar más animales. Su meta es tener más animales y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the Paradise communal bank for a year. She lives in a community that belongs to the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, where one can find large livestock farms and romantic, old properties. Rosa is 47 years old, and she is divorced. She has four children, three of which are older; two of those are married and live on their own. Her single son works and helps her economically, and her last, a daughter, is studying in a school in the town. The house they live in is her own. 

Rosa has been working as a farmer, and she sells her products and uses them at home as well. She also raises animals like chickens and guinea pigs. This new loan is to buy pigs and increase her stock of animals. Rosa's goal is to have more animals that are of better quality.

loans.use: buy pigs.

loans.name: Angélica Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Angélica forma parte del grupo de crédito El Paraíso, vive por una  comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, donde se encuentran  grandes fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas. Su grupo de crédito es unido y siempre se apoyan para salir en adelante y crecer en sus negocios.
La Señora Angélica tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Angélica pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero también se dedica a la agricultura y la cría de cuyes y gallinas. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cuyes y alimento para animales Su meta es criar mas animales en especial cuyes.
texts.en:
Angélica is part of the "El Paraíso" loan group. She lives in a community that is part of the Cumbe parish in Cuenca. Here there are large cattle-raising ranches and romantic old country estates. Angélica's loan group is close-knit, and the members are already supporting each other in order to grow and prosper in their businesses.

Angélica is 25 years old, married and has two children, aged four and two years old each. Angélica's husband works as a builder; the family owns the house where they live.

Angélica stays at home to look after her children but she also works in farming and raising guinea pigs and hens. This loan will be used to buy guinea pigs and animal feed. Her goal is to raise more animals, particularly guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a businesswoman from Poblacion, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she decided to raise pigs in her own backyard. 

She has reached out to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for her capital needs. Now, she requests a loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 49 years old, married, and has seven children. With three children in school, Eulalia works very hard to provide for them.

Eulalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items like sardines, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Eulalia has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Eulalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sardines, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers in order to prepare the land before a great harvest

loans.name: José Cristobal

texts.es: José Cristobal es una persona de 40 años de edad, Casado, quien tiene cinco hijos, un varones y cuatro mujeres, quienes vive en el departamento de Sololá.El se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos  principalmente papa y maíz, eligió esta actividad debido a que son cultivos que se adaptan a las condiciones de la región, y es donde obtiene una parte de sus ingresos, además realiza actividad de albañilería (Construcción y remodelación de viviendas), con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos y contribuir al sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 1,000.00 para la compra de fertilizante que utilizara en el cultivo de maíz y papa e incrementar el rendimiento de la producción. El sueño que tiene es impulsar a sus hijos en el estudio hasta verlos graduados.
texts.en: José Cristobal is a 40-year-old person; he is married and has five children, one boy and four girls, who live in the department of Sololá.  He works in farming for a living growing vegetables and staple grains, mainly potatoes and corn.  He chose this business because these are crops that are adapted to the conditions in the region and it generates part of his income.  He also does construction work (building and remodeling homes) in order to increase his income and contribute to his family's upkeep.  He is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 quetzals to buy fertilizer, which he will use on his corn and potato crops to increase his yield of produce.  His dream is to encourage his children to study until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his corn and potato crops

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 62 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a dos nietos y desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida por medio de la venta de tortillas. Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy visionaria quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para  llevar el sustento a su hogar. Isabel solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared en su vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Isabel is 62 years old and lives in her own home together with two grandchildren, and for a long time she has made her living selling tortillas.  Isabel is a very hardworking and visionary woman who does everything in her power to support her household.  Isabel is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a wall in her home for which she needs materials such as brick, cement, sand, and rebar.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and rebar to build a wall

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 60 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her one child. She cultivates and plants corn and beans.

Dominga wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 60 years old, married and a farmer from La Libertad. She and her husband are hands-on cultivating their agricultural land, planting rice, corn and beans. 

Josefina wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia desde  hace 2 años  del grupo de crédito El Paraíso, este grupo le gusta por la solidaridad y compañerismo que existe en el, al mismo tiempo los crédito le ayudan a salir adelante en su negocio. Vive por una  comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, donde se encuentran  grandes fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas.
La Señora. María tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 11, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo labora en la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
Doña María pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta, también cría cerdos, cuyes y pollos. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de pollos y  alimento de animales. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María has been a member of El Paraíso Group for two years.  She likes this group because of its solidarity and comradeship and the loans help her to get ahead with her business.  She lives in a community that belongs to the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, where there are huge livestock farms and romantic old properties.  

María is 30 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage, who are 11, 5, and 3 years old.  Her first two children are in school; her husband works in construction; they do not have their own home, rather they live with a relative. 

María cares for her children at home.  She works in farming, which is for her household consumption and for sale.  She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.  The money from her loan is to buy chickens and animal feed.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma has been working on her own farm for many years to make a living. With her generated income from farm produce, she has been able to sustain her living. Planning to improve the farm, she took a new loan recently to purchase planting materials and to cover the costs of weeding maintenance. Gemma hopes to increase her harvest to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland. Gemma's photo was taken with her motorcycle, which she uses to carrying her farm products and to provide transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase planting materials and to cover the costs of weeding maintenance

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive en casa de sus padres junto sus hermanos y padres en el distrito de Zaña una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, los cría en una inverna cerca a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de 01 vaca lechera que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos con la venta de leche de fresca y producción de queso fresco.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 35 years old; his marriage status is single.  He lives in his parents' home with his siblings and parents in the district of Zaña, which is a community of merchants, farmers, and ranchers located in the Province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeqye Region on Peru's northern coast.

He raises and sells small animals for a living.  He raises them on a pasture close to his home.  He has requested a loan of 600 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy one dairy cow, which will allow him to make more money buy selling fresh milk and making fresh cheese.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow, which will allow him to make more income

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es: Doña Ada, sigue dedicándose a su actividad comercial que es la venta de Ropa de segunda mano, ella desea invertir mas en su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias ya que colabora con el sustento de la casa, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia como electricista y entre los dos comparten los gastos del hogar, comprara Dos Pacas de Ropa Mixtas una para niños y otra para adultos, Agradece el apoyo que nuevamente Kiva y Afodenic le están brindando con este crédito ya que sus condiciones de vida y su familia han mejorado.
texts.en: Ada is still working at her business, which is selling secondhand clothing.  She wants to invest more in her business to make more profit, as she contributes to the upkeep of her household.  Her husband works independently as an electrician and between the two of them, they split the household expenses.  She will buy two bundles of mixed clothing, one for children and one for adults.  She is thankful for the help Kiva and Afodenic have once again provided to her with this loan, as living conditions for her and her family have improved.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing

loans.name: Mety

texts.en: Mety requested a PHP 12,000 loan through PMPC to buy more firewood to sell. She has been in this business for three years now. Mety would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Replanting is an activity that this small farmer has decided to undertake in a gradual manner. In the end, he will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring about more income so that he can provide better conditions for the family.

Nilo is married and earns a living from his farm in his village. For five years, he has earned well enough to provide his family's needs. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, he wants to improve his farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is 52 years old and widowed with two children. One of her children is in school. Conception works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like sardines, soap, soy sauce, vinegar, etc. 

Conception has been in this business for three years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her son to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like sardines, soap, soy sauce, and vinegar

loans.name: Sinignesigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SINIGNESIGUI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à NIEROUANI un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame DJENEBA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SINIGNESIGUI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sinignesigui 1 group are married women averaging 47 years of age, with four children. They live mainly in traditional families in Nierouani, a village in the township of Louloni, the district of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their eight agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans. They grow rice, which is what Mrs. Djeneba does, for example. She is the first one standing from right to left in the group photo.

With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg [110 lbs] pounds of fertilizers and two jugs of herbicide as well as pay for the cost of labor to work 0.5 ha [1 acre] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce at her village and in Sikasso, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 85,000 West African francs per agricultural campaign. This revenue will allow him to pay off a part of her loan with interest and use the rest to help her husband with everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos Group

texts.es:
MARIA ISABEL. Tiene 42 años. Vive en Borbón con su esposo y sus  4 hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la comercialización de madera. Sus hijos asisten normalmente a clases. Ella desde hace 2 años. Se dedica a la comercialización de bebidas refrescantes. Gaseosas. Botellas de agua. Jugos naturales en un pequeño kiosco  improvisado en su casa  donde aprovecha el paso de las unidades de transporte interprovincial para vender sus productos. 
Se enteró de FODEMI y las ventajas de tener la posibilidad de crecer en su negocio. Gracias a las amigas del barrio. Quienes ya tienen crédito con esta institución.
MARIA ISABEL. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene deseos de tener en el futuro un local cómodo que brinde las posibilidades de atender mejor a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo desea brindar la comodidad a padres de familia de adquirir el refrigerio de sus hijos (estudiantes) cerca de casa. Por lo cual comprará: avenas preparadas. Yogurt. Galletas fortificadas. Y cereales que aporten a la buena nutrición de los estudiantes. Ya que por muchos años han estado consumiendo productos que no aportan a su salud.
Para completar este negocio y surtir más el local.  Implementara la venta de productos plásticos (tarrinas. Vasos. Cucharas) y otros utensilios que se requieren mucho en el sector.
INFORMACION ADICIONAL.
Todos los integrantes del grupo son del  mismo sector y se dedican a actividades diferentes. Cada uno recibirá la suma de $500,00 dólares y además ellos se reúnen mensualmente para acordar el pago de la letra del crédito.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 42 years old.  She lives in Borbón with her husband and their four children.  Her husband sells wood for a living.  Her children normally attend school.  For two years now she has been selling soft drinks, such as sodas, bottled water, and natural juices, at a small, improvised kiosk in her home where she takes advantage of the passing interprovincial transport vehicles to sell her products.  

She found out about FODEMI and the advantages of having the possibility of growing her business thanks to her friends from the neighborhood who already loans with this institution.  

Maria Isabel is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who wants a comfortable shop in the future that will allow her to better serve her customers.  

With this loan she wants to offer parents the convenience of having snacks for their children (students) close to home.  For this she will buy prepared oatmeal, yogurt, fortified cookies, and cereals that are nutritious for the students, as for many years they have been eating products that are not healthy.  

To complete this business and stock her store more she will sell plastic products (containers, cups, spoons) and other utensils that are greatly needed in this business.  

Additional Information
All the members of this group are from the same area and have different businesses.  They will each receive a sum of $500.00 dollars and they also meet monthly to arrange payment of their loans.

loans.use: to buy healthy foods for school snacks

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
Annie Rose is 34 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Annie Rose has a general store business in the Philippines. Annie Rose requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack food, toys, beverages and other groceries.

Annie Rose has been in this business for two years. In the future, Annie Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, toys, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is 46 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Dioscora has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Dioscora requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feeds for her business. In the future, Dioscora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds for her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a hardworking mom who makes a living farming; she owns a mango farm and earns a good income with her husband. Leonila started the business five years ago. She starts overseeing the farm early in the morning when her husband is busy with his work; they work together more often on weekends. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides for mango production. She is determined to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides for mango production.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is running a dressmaking service in her community while her husband in earning income from his work as a carpenter.  She personally cuts fabric and sews it according to orders and customer demand. She also accommodates made-to-order curtains. 

With these activities, she earns well for their living and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for this business. This season, classes started and she works sewing school uniforms for students, and she had many orders. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional fabrics and materials. She is hopeful to gain more revenue from her investment and wants to be able to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Rosita has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from raising chickens.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Norma has been in this business for 13 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Paterna is 40 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Paterna requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Paterna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Seng Kun

texts.en:
Seng Kun is a weaver and her husband is a farmer. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment factory worker and another one is an auto repairman.
 
Seng Kun is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son for commuting. Seng’s son, who is an auto repairman, needs to stay at his work place. With a motorbike, which she will buy with money from the loan, he will be able to visit his home sometimes on the weekend!

In the photo is Seng Kun with her loom.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son for commuting.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from dressmaking and retailing soft drinks. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more fertilized duck embryos to sell for her food vending business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilized duck embryos to sell

loans.name: Godilla

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Godilla works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Godilla is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to resell for her buy-and-sell fruits business.

Godilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to buy farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more educational material for her son

loans.name: Sokkriyas

texts.en:
Sokkriyas (in the photo), age 40, is a security guard for a nightclub in Phnom Penh city. He lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has three children, one son and two daughters. Two of his children have full-time employment and the other one attends school.

His wife sells nets and blankets. She orders nets and blankets from Vietnam, one of Cambodia’s neighboring countries, and she resells them at a market in Phnom Penh. She wants to increase the volume of nets and blankets she buys and sells.  

Hence, Sokkriyas applied for a loan to help his wife!

loans.use: to buy additional nets and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Mariyom

texts.en:
Mariyom (in the photo), age 54, is a widow with two sons and one daughter. One of her children is married, another one is a gas station attendant and another attends school. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.
 
Mariyom sells grilled beef and chicken in front of the garment factory. She wants her daughter who is attending school to use her tailoring skills after class. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan in order to buy a sewing machine for her.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her daughter.

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mak, 40, lives with her husband and three children in a small village of the Preah Sdach District in Prey Veng Province. She has worked in agribusiness for more than ten years in order to meet the needs of her children who are enrolling in school. Working in the framing business with her husband, Mak is able to make a net income of 3 USD per day to meet her family’s daily expenditures.

Currently, Mak is applying for a 500 USD loan, which is her first loan, to buy a solar energy system to supply energy to her household. She hopes that, with the loan, she can provide a comfortable lifestyle for all of her children. Finally, she is grateful for the loan granted through HKL which has a much lower interest rate than usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en: Robilyn is married with five children. She operates a fishing business together with her husband to earn a living. For more than 15 years in running the business, they have earned well for the family.  She is determined to send her children to school and provide a better education. For this reason, they work with love and they never get tired of working. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fishing nets. In the future, she wants to build a concrete home for the family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to resell for her business.

Gloria has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to resell for her business.

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailani is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lailani is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and a new variety of rice and pay the laborers' salaries.

Lailani has been farming rice for 30 years and earns additional income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and a new variety of rice and pay labor fees

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mara, age 35, is a silk weaver while her husband works for a factory that produces cigarettes. She lives on an island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been married since 2007 and has two children, one son and one daughter. One of her children attends school, and another one is still young.

Mara hopes to continue her weaving business, so she decided to apply for a loan to buy silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy silk material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Youn

texts.en:
Youn lives with her brother in a village on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has six sons and one daughter. Three of her children are married and live away from home, one is a garment factory worker, two attend school and another one works for a hospital. 
Youn sells fast food in her local primary school, while her husband works for a hospital. Youn’s home does not have a stair rail (shown in photo), and she is afraid of someone having an accident and falling down from the house. That’s why she decided to apply for a loan to put a stair rail on her house. She will use the rest of the loan to build a restroom for her family's use because she does not have a proper restroom.

loans.use: To put a stair rail on her house and build a restroom for her family's use
